clauses-english.clause: Alif,
Lam,
Meem,
Sad.

956.verse-arabic: كِتَابٌ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ فَلَا يَكُن فِي صَدْرِكَ حَرَجٌ مِّنْهُ لِتُنذِرَ بِهِ وَذِكْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
956.verse-english: [This is] a Book revealed to you, [O Muhammad] - so let there not be in your breast distress therefrom - that you may warn thereby and as a reminder to the believers.

clauses-english.clause: [This is] a Book revealed to you,
[O Muhammad] -
so let there not be in your breast distress therefrom -
that you may warn thereby and as a reminder to the believers.

957.verse-arabic: اتَّبِعُوا مَا أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكُم مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَلَا تَتَّبِعُوا مِن دُونِهِ أَوْلِيَاءَ ۗ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
957.verse-english: Follow, [O mankind], what has been revealed to you from your Lord and do not follow other than Him any allies. Little do you remember.

clauses-english.clause: Follow,
[O mankind],
what has been revealed to you from your Lord and do not follow other than Him any allies.
Little do you remember.

958.verse-arabic: وَكَم مِّن قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَاهَا فَجَاءَهَا بَأْسُنَا بَيَاتًا أَوْ هُمْ قَائِلُونَ
958.verse-english: And how many cities have We destroyed, and Our punishment came to them at night or while they were sleeping at noon.

clauses-english.clause: And how many cities have We destroyed,
and Our punishment came to them at night or while they were sleeping at noon.

959.verse-arabic: فَمَا كَانَ دَعْوَاهُمْ إِذْ جَاءَهُم بَأْسُنَا إِلَّا أَن قَالُوا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
959.verse-english: And their declaration when Our punishment came to them was only that they said, "Indeed, we were wrongdoers!"

clauses-english.clause: And their declaration when Our punishment came to them was only that they said,
"Indeed,
we were wrongdoers!

960.verse-arabic: فَلَنَسْأَلَنَّ الَّذِينَ أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْهِمْ وَلَنَسْأَلَنَّ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
960.verse-english: Then We will surely question those to whom [a message] was sent, and We will surely question the messengers.

clauses-english.clause: Then We will surely question those to whom [a message] was sent,
and We will surely question the messengers.

961.verse-arabic: فَلَنَقُصَّنَّ عَلَيْهِم بِعِلْمٍ ۖ وَمَا كُنَّا غَائِبِينَ
961.verse-english: Then We will surely relate [their deeds] to them with knowledge, and We were not [at all] absent.

clauses-english.clause: Then We will surely relate [their deeds] to them with knowledge,
and We were not [at all] absent.

962.verse-arabic: وَالْوَزْنُ يَوْمَئِذٍ الْحَقُّ ۚ فَمَن ثَقُلَتْ مَوَازِينُهُ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
962.verse-english: And the weighing [of deeds] that Day will be the truth. So those whose scales are heavy - it is they who will be the successful.

clauses-english.clause: And the weighing [of deeds] that Day will be the truth.
So those whose scales are heavy -
it is they who will be the successful.

963.verse-arabic: وَمَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَازِينُهُ فَأُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ خَسِرُوا أَنفُسَهُم بِمَا كَانُوا بِآيَاتِنَا يَظْلِمُونَ
963.verse-english: And those whose scales are light - they are the ones who will lose themselves for what injustice they were doing toward Our verses.

clauses-english.clause: And those whose scales are light -
they are the ones who will lose themselves for what injustice they were doing toward Our verses.

964.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ مَكَّنَّاكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَجَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَعَايِشَ ۗ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ
964.verse-english: And We have certainly established you upon the earth and made for you therein ways of livelihood. Little are you grateful.

clauses-english.clause: And We have certainly established you upon the earth and made for you therein ways of livelihood.
Little are you grateful.

965.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَاكُمْ ثُمَّ صَوَّرْنَاكُمْ ثُمَّ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ اسْجُدُوا لِآدَمَ فَسَجَدُوا إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ لَمْ يَكُن مِّنَ السَّاجِدِينَ
965.verse-english: And We have certainly created you, [O Mankind], and given you [human] form. Then We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam"; so they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was not of those who prostrated.

clauses-english.clause: And We have certainly created you,
[O Mankind],
and given you [human] form.
Then We said to the angels,
"Prostrate to Adam";
so they prostrated,
except for Iblees.
He was not of those who prostrated.

966.verse-arabic: قَالَ مَا مَنَعَكَ أَلَّا تَسْجُدَ إِذْ أَمَرْتُكَ ۖ قَالَ أَنَا خَيْرٌ مِّنْهُ خَلَقْتَنِي مِن نَّارٍ وَخَلَقْتَهُ مِن طِينٍ
966.verse-english: [Allah] said, "What prevented you from prostrating when I commanded you?" [Satan] said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."

clauses-english.clause: [God] said,
"What prevented you from prostrating when I commanded you?
" [Satan] said,
"I am better than him.
You created me from fire and created him from clay.

967.verse-arabic: قَالَ فَاهْبِطْ مِنْهَا فَمَا يَكُونُ لَكَ أَن تَتَكَبَّرَ فِيهَا فَاخْرُجْ إِنَّكَ مِنَ الصَّاغِرِينَ
967.verse-english: [Allah] said, "Descend from Paradise, for it is not for you to be arrogant therein. So get out; indeed, you are of the debased.

clauses-english.clause: [God] said,
"Descend from Paradise,
for it is not for you to be arrogant therein.
So get out;
indeed,
you are of the debased.

968.verse-english: [Satan] said, "Reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

clauses-english.clause: [Satan] said,
"Reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected.

969.verse-english: [Allah] said, "Indeed, you are of those reprieved."

clauses-english.clause: [God] said,
"Indeed,
you are of those reprieved.

970.verse-arabic: قَالَ فَبِمَا أَغْوَيْتَنِي لَأَقْعُدَنَّ لَهُمْ صِرَاطَكَ الْمُسْتَقِيمَ
970.verse-english: [Satan] said, "Because You have put me in error, I will surely sit in wait for them on Your straight path.

clauses-english.clause: [Satan] said,
"Because You have put me in error,
I will surely sit in wait for them on Your straight path.

971.verse-arabic: ثُمَّ لَآتِيَنَّهُم مِّن بَيْنِ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِمْ وَعَنْ أَيْمَانِهِمْ وَعَن شَمَائِلِهِمْ ۖ وَلَا تَجِدُ أَكْثَرَهُمْ شَاكِرِينَ
971.verse-english: Then I will come to them from before them and from behind them and on their right and on their left, and You will not find most of them grateful [to You]."

clauses-english.clause: Then I will come to them from before them and from behind them and on their right and on their left,
and You will not find most of them grateful [to You].

972.verse-arabic: قَالَ اخْرُجْ مِنْهَا مَذْءُومًا مَّدْحُورًا ۖ لَّمَن تَبِعَكَ مِنْهُمْ لَأَمْلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
972.verse-english: [Allah] said, "Get out of Paradise, reproached and expelled. Whoever follows you among them - I will surely fill Hell with you, all together."

clauses-english.clause: [God] said,
"Get out of Paradise,
reproached and expelled.
Whoever follows you among them -
I will surely fill Hell with you,
all together.

973.verse-arabic: وَيَا آدَمُ اسْكُنْ أَنتَ وَزَوْجُكَ الْجَنَّةَ فَكُلَا مِنْ حَيْثُ شِئْتُمَا وَلَا تَقْرَبَا هَٰذِهِ الشَّجَرَةَ فَتَكُونَا مِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ
973.verse-english: And "O Adam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise and eat from wherever you will but do not approach this tree, lest you be among the wrongdoers."

clauses-english.clause: And "O Adam,
dwell,
you and your wife,
in Paradise and eat from wherever you will but do not approach this tree,
lest you be among the wrongdoers.

974.verse-arabic: فَوَسْوَسَ لَهُمَا الشَّيْطَانُ لِيُبْدِيَ لَهُمَا مَا وُورِيَ عَنْهُمَا مِن سَوْآتِهِمَا وَقَالَ مَا نَهَاكُمَا رَبُّكُمَا عَنْ هَٰذِهِ الشَّجَرَةِ إِلَّا أَن تَكُونَا مَلَكَيْنِ أَوْ تَكُونَا مِنَ الْخَالِدِينَ
974.verse-english: But Satan whispered to them to make apparent to them that which was concealed from them of their private parts. He said, "Your Lord did not forbid you this tree except that you become angels or become of the immortal."

clauses-english.clause: But Satan whispered to them to make apparent to them that which was concealed from them of their private parts.
He said,
"Your Lord did not forbid you this tree except that you become angels or become of the immortal.

975.verse-english: And he swore [by Allah] to them, "Indeed, I am to you from among the sincere advisors."

clauses-english.clause: And he swore [by God] to them,
"Indeed,
I am to you from among the sincere advisors.

976.verse-arabic: فَدَلَّاهُمَا بِغُرُورٍ ۚ فَلَمَّا ذَاقَا الشَّجَرَةَ بَدَتْ لَهُمَا سَوْآتُهُمَا وَطَفِقَا يَخْصِفَانِ عَلَيْهِمَا مِن وَرَقِ الْجَنَّةِ ۖ وَنَادَاهُمَا رَبُّهُمَا أَلَمْ أَنْهَكُمَا عَن تِلْكُمَا الشَّجَرَةِ وَأَقُل لَّكُمَا إِنَّ الشَّيْطَانَ لَكُمَا عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ
976.verse-english: So he made them fall, through deception. And when they tasted of the tree, their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten together over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And their Lord called to them, "Did I not forbid you from that tree and tell you that Satan is to you a clear enemy?"

clauses-english.clause: So he made them fall,
through deception.
And when they tasted of the tree,
their private parts became apparent to them,
and they began to fasten together over themselves from the leaves of Paradise.
And their Lord called to them,
"Did I not forbid you from that tree and tell you that Satan is to you a clear enemy?

977.verse-arabic: قَالَا رَبَّنَا ظَلَمْنَا أَنفُسَنَا وَإِن لَّمْ تَغْفِرْ لَنَا وَتَرْحَمْنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ
977.verse-english: They said, "Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers."

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"Our Lord,
we have wronged ourselves,
and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us,
we will surely be among the losers.

978.verse-arabic: قَالَ اهْبِطُوا بَعْضُكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ ۖ وَلَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ مُسْتَقَرٌّ وَمَتَاعٌ إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
978.verse-english: [Allah] said, "Descend, being to one another enemies. And for you on the earth is a place of settlement and enjoyment for a time."

clauses-english.clause: [God] said,
"Descend,
being to one another enemies.
And for you on the earth is a place of settlement and enjoyment for a time.

979.verse-arabic: قَالَ فِيهَا تَحْيَوْنَ وَفِيهَا تَمُوتُونَ وَمِنْهَا تُخْرَجُونَ
979.verse-english: He said, "Therein you will live, and therein you will die, and from it you will be brought forth."

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"Therein you will live,
and therein you will die,
and from it you will be brought forth.

980.verse-arabic: يَا بَنِي آدَمَ قَدْ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكُمْ لِبَاسًا يُوَارِي سَوْآتِكُمْ وَرِيشًا ۖ وَلِبَاسُ التَّقْوَىٰ ذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ آيَاتِ اللَّهِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
980.verse-english: O children of Adam, We have bestowed upon you clothing to conceal your private parts and as adornment. But the clothing of righteousness - that is best. That is from the signs of Allah that perhaps they will remember.

clauses-english.clause: O children of Adam,
We have bestowed upon you clothing to conceal your private parts and as adornment.
But the clothing of righteousness -
that is best.
That is from the signs of God that perhaps they will remember.

981.verse-arabic: يَا بَنِي آدَمَ لَا يَفْتِنَنَّكُمُ الشَّيْطَانُ كَمَا أَخْرَجَ أَبَوَيْكُم مِّنَ الْجَنَّةِ يَنزِعُ عَنْهُمَا لِبَاسَهُمَا لِيُرِيَهُمَا سَوْآتِهِمَا ۗ إِنَّهُ يَرَاكُمْ هُوَ وَقَبِيلُهُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا تَرَوْنَهُمْ ۗ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا الشَّيَاطِينَ أَوْلِيَاءَ لِلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
981.verse-english: O children of Adam, let not Satan tempt you as he removed your parents from Paradise, stripping them of their clothing to show them their private parts. Indeed, he sees you, he and his tribe, from where you do not see them. Indeed, We have made the devils allies to those who do not believe.

clauses-english.clause: O children of Adam,
let not Satan tempt you as he removed your parents from Paradise,
stripping them of their clothing to show them their private parts.
Indeed,
he sees you,
he and his tribe,
from where you do not see them.
Indeed,
We have made the devils allies to those who do not believe.

982.verse-arabic: وَإِذَا فَعَلُوا فَاحِشَةً قَالُوا وَجَدْنَا عَلَيْهَا آبَاءَنَا وَاللَّهُ أَمَرَنَا بِهَا ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَأْمُرُ بِالْفَحْشَاءِ ۖ أَتَقُولُونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
982.verse-english: And when they commit an immorality, they say, "We found our fathers doing it, and Allah has ordered us to do it." Say, "Indeed, Allah does not order immorality. Do you say about Allah that which you do not know?"

clauses-english.clause: And when they commit an immorality,
they say,
"We found our fathers doing it,
and God has ordered us to do it.
" Say,
"Indeed,
God does not order immorality.
Do you say about God that which you do not know?

983.verse-arabic: قُلْ أَمَرَ رَبِّي بِالْقِسْطِ ۖ وَأَقِيمُوا وُجُوهَكُمْ عِندَ كُلِّ مَسْجِدٍ وَادْعُوهُ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ ۚ كَمَا بَدَأَكُمْ تَعُودُونَ
983.verse-english: Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord has ordered justice and that you maintain yourselves [in worship of Him] at every place [or time] of prostration, and invoke Him, sincere to Him in religion." Just as He originated you, you will return [to life] -

clauses-english.clause: Say,
[O Muhammad],
"My Lord has ordered justice and that you maintain yourselves [in worship of Him] at every place [or time] of prostration,
and invoke Him,
sincere to Him in religion.
" Just as He originated you,
you will return [to life] -

984.verse-arabic: فَرِيقًا هَدَىٰ وَفَرِيقًا حَقَّ عَلَيْهِمُ الضَّلَالَةُ ۗ إِنَّهُمُ اتَّخَذُوا الشَّيَاطِينَ أَوْلِيَاءَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ وَيَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُم مُّهْتَدُونَ
984.verse-english: A group [of you] He guided, and a group deserved [to be in] error. Indeed, they had taken the devils as allies instead of Allah while they thought that they were guided.

clauses-english.clause: A group [of you] He guided,
and a group deserved [to be in] error.
Indeed,
they had taken the devils as allies instead of God while they thought that they were guided.

985.verse-arabic: ۞ يَا بَنِي آدَمَ خُذُوا زِينَتَكُمْ عِندَ كُلِّ مَسْجِدٍ وَكُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا وَلَا تُسْرِفُوا ۚ إِنَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ الْمُسْرِفِينَ
985.verse-english: O children of Adam, take your adornment at every masjid, and eat and drink, but be not excessive. Indeed, He likes not those who commit excess.

clauses-english.clause: O children of Adam,
take your adornment at every masjid,
and eat and drink,
but be not excessive.
Indeed,
He likes not those who commit excess.

986.verse-arabic: قُلْ مَنْ حَرَّمَ زِينَةَ اللَّهِ الَّتِي أَخْرَجَ لِعِبَادِهِ وَالطَّيِّبَاتِ مِنَ الرِّزْقِ ۚ قُلْ هِيَ لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا خَالِصَةً يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ الْآيَاتِ لِقَوْمٍ يَعْلَمُونَ
986.verse-english: Say, "Who has forbidden the adornment of Allah which He has produced for His servants and the good [lawful] things of provision?" Say, "They are for those who believe during the worldly life [but] exclusively for them on the Day of Resurrection." Thus do We detail the verses for a people who know.

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"Who has forbidden the adornment of God which He has produced for His servants and the good [lawful] things of provision?
" Say,
"They are for those who believe during the worldly life [but] exclusively for them on the Day of Resurrection.
" Thus do We detail the verses for a people who know.

987.verse-arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا حَرَّمَ رَبِّيَ الْفَوَاحِشَ مَا ظَهَرَ مِنْهَا وَمَا بَطَنَ وَالْإِثْمَ وَالْبَغْيَ بِغَيْرِ الْحَقِّ وَأَن تُشْرِكُوا بِاللَّهِ مَا لَمْ يُنَزِّلْ بِهِ سُلْطَانًا وَأَن تَقُولُوا عَلَى اللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
987.verse-english: Say, "My Lord has only forbidden immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed - and sin, and oppression without right, and that you associate with Allah that for which He has not sent down authority, and that you say about Allah that which you do not know."

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"My Lord has only forbidden immoralities -
what is apparent of them and what is concealed -
and sin,
and oppression without right,
and that you associate with God that for which He has not sent down authority,
and that you say about God that which you do not know.

988.verse-arabic: وَلِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلٌ ۖ فَإِذَا جَاءَ أَجَلُهُمْ لَا يَسْتَأْخِرُونَ سَاعَةً ۖ وَلَا يَسْتَقْدِمُونَ
988.verse-english: And for every nation is a [specified] term. So when their time has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].

clauses-english.clause: And for every nation is a [specified] term.
So when their time has come,
they will not remain behind an hour,
nor will they precede [it].

989.verse-arabic: يَا بَنِي آدَمَ إِمَّا يَأْتِيَنَّكُمْ رُسُلٌ مِّنكُمْ يَقُصُّونَ عَلَيْكُمْ آيَاتِي ۙ فَمَنِ اتَّقَىٰ وَأَصْلَحَ فَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
989.verse-english: O children of Adam, if there come to you messengers from among you relating to you My verses, then whoever fears Allah and reforms - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

clauses-english.clause: O children of Adam,
if there come to you messengers from among you relating to you My verses,
then whoever fears God and reforms -
there will be no fear concerning them,
nor will they grieve.

990.verse-arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا وَاسْتَكْبَرُوا عَنْهَا أُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ النَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ
990.verse-english: But the ones who deny Our verses and are arrogant toward them - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.

clauses-english.clause: But the ones who deny Our verses and are arrogant toward them -
those are the companions of the Fire;
they will abide therein eternally.

991.verse-arabic: فَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَوْ كَذَّبَ بِآيَاتِهِ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ يَنَالُهُمْ نَصِيبُهُم مِّنَ الْكِتَابِ ۖ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُنَا يَتَوَفَّوْنَهُمْ قَالُوا أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ ۖ قَالُوا ضَلُّوا عَنَّا وَشَهِدُوا عَلَىٰ أَنفُسِهِمْ أَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا كَافِرِينَ
991.verse-english: And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah a lie or denies His verses? Those will attain their portion of the decree until when Our messengers come to them to take them in death, they will say, "Where are those you used to invoke besides Allah?" They will say, "They have departed from us," and will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.

clauses-english.clause: And who is more unjust than one who invents about God a lie or denies His verses?
Those will attain their portion of the decree until when Our messengers come to them to take them in death,
they will say,
"Where are those you used to invoke besides God?
" They will say,
"They have departed from us,
" and will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.

992.verse-arabic: قَالَ ادْخُلُوا فِي أُمَمٍ قَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِكُم مِّنَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنسِ فِي النَّارِ ۖ كُلَّمَا دَخَلَتْ أُمَّةٌ لَّعَنَتْ أُخْتَهَا ۖ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا ادَّارَكُوا فِيهَا جَمِيعًا قَالَتْ أُخْرَاهُمْ لِأُولَاهُمْ رَبَّنَا هَٰؤُلَاءِ أَضَلُّونَا فَآتِهِمْ عَذَابًا ضِعْفًا مِّنَ النَّارِ ۖ قَالَ لِكُلٍّ ضِعْفٌ وَلَٰكِن لَّا تَعْلَمُونَ
992.verse-english: [Allah] will say, "Enter among nations which had passed on before you of jinn and mankind into the Fire." Every time a nation enters, it will curse its sister until, when they have all overtaken one another therein, the last of them will say about the first of them "Our Lord, these had misled us, so give them a double punishment of the Fire. He will say, "For each is double, but you do not know."

clauses-english.clause: [God] will say,
"Enter among nations which had passed on before you of jinn and mankind into the Fire.
" Every time a nation enters,
it will curse its sister until,
when they have all overtaken one another therein,
the last of them will say about the first of them "Our Lord,
these had misled us,
so give them a double punishment of the Fire.
He will say,
"For each is double,
but you do not know.

993.verse-arabic: وَقَالَتْ أُولَاهُمْ لِأُخْرَاهُمْ فَمَا كَانَ لَكُمْ عَلَيْنَا مِن فَضْلٍ فَذُوقُوا الْعَذَابَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْسِبُونَ
993.verse-english: And the first of them will say to the last of them, "Then you had not any favor over us, so taste the punishment for what you used to earn."

clauses-english.clause: And the first of them will say to the last of them,
"Then you had not any favor over us,
so taste the punishment for what you used to earn.

994.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا وَاسْتَكْبَرُوا عَنْهَا لَا تُفَتَّحُ لَهُمْ أَبْوَابُ السَّمَاءِ وَلَا يَدْخُلُونَ الْجَنَّةَ حَتَّىٰ يَلِجَ الْجَمَلُ فِي سَمِّ الْخِيَاطِ ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُجْرِمِينَ
994.verse-english: Indeed, those who deny Our verses and are arrogant toward them - the gates of Heaven will not be opened for them, nor will they enter Paradise until a camel enters into the eye of a needle. And thus do We recompense the criminals.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
those who deny Our verses and are arrogant toward them -
the gates of Heaven will not be opened for them,
nor will they enter Paradise until a camel enters into the eye of a needle.
And thus do We recompense the criminals.

995.verse-arabic: لَهُم مِّن جَهَنَّمَ مِهَادٌ وَمِن فَوْقِهِمْ غَوَاشٍ ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الظَّالِمِينَ
995.verse-english: They will have from Hell a bed and over them coverings [of fire]. And thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.

clauses-english.clause: They will have from Hell a bed and over them coverings [of fire].
And thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.

996.verse-arabic: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَا نُكَلِّفُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا أُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ الْجَنَّةِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ
996.verse-english: But those who believed and did righteous deeds - We charge no soul except [within] its capacity. Those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide therein eternally.

clauses-english.clause: But those who believed and did righteous deeds -
We charge no soul except [within] its capacity.
Those are the companions of Paradise;
they will abide therein eternally.

997.verse-arabic: وَنَزَعْنَا مَا فِي صُدُورِهِم مِّنْ غِلٍّ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهِمُ الْأَنْهَارُ ۖ وَقَالُوا الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي هَدَانَا لِهَٰذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لِنَهْتَدِيَ لَوْلَا أَنْ هَدَانَا اللَّهُ ۖ لَقَدْ جَاءَتْ رُسُلُ رَبِّنَا بِالْحَقِّ ۖ وَنُودُوا أَن تِلْكُمُ الْجَنَّةُ أُورِثْتُمُوهَا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
997.verse-english: And We will have removed whatever is within their breasts of resentment, [while] flowing beneath them are rivers. And they will say, "Praise to Allah, who has guided us to this; and we would never have been guided if Allah had not guided us. Certainly the messengers of our Lord had come with the truth." And they will be called, "This is Paradise, which you have been made to inherit for what you used to do."

clauses-english.clause: And We will have removed whatever is within their breasts of resentment,
[while] flowing beneath them are rivers.
And they will say,
"Praise to God,
who has guided us to this;
and we would never have been guided if God had not guided us.
Certainly the messengers of our Lord had come with the truth.
" And they will be called,
"This is Paradise,
which you have been made to inherit for what you used to do.

998.verse-arabic: وَنَادَىٰ أَصْحَابُ الْجَنَّةِ أَصْحَابَ النَّارِ أَن قَدْ وَجَدْنَا مَا وَعَدَنَا رَبُّنَا حَقًّا فَهَلْ وَجَدتُّم مَّا وَعَدَ رَبُّكُمْ حَقًّا ۖ قَالُوا نَعَمْ ۚ فَأَذَّنَ مُؤَذِّنٌ بَيْنَهُمْ أَن لَّعْنَةُ اللَّهِ عَلَى الظَّالِمِينَ
998.verse-english: And the companions of Paradise will call out to the companions of the Fire, "We have already found what our Lord promised us to be true. Have you found what your Lord promised to be true?" They will say, "Yes." Then an announcer will announce among them, "The curse of Allah shall be upon the wrongdoers."

clauses-english.clause: And the companions of Paradise will call out to the companions of the Fire,
"We have already found what our Lord promised us to be true.
Have you found what your Lord promised to be true?
" They will say,
"Yes.
" Then an announcer will announce among them,
"The curse of God shall be upon the wrongdoers.

999.verse-arabic: الَّذِينَ يَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَيَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًا وَهُم بِالْآخِرَةِ كَافِرُونَ
999.verse-english: Who averted [people] from the way of Allah and sought to make it [seem] deviant while they were, concerning the Hereafter, disbelievers.

clauses-english.clause: Who averted [people] from the way of God and sought to make it [seem] deviant while they were,
concerning the Hereafter,
disbelievers.

1000.verse-arabic: وَبَيْنَهُمَا حِجَابٌ ۚ وَعَلَى الْأَعْرَافِ رِجَالٌ يَعْرِفُونَ كُلًّا بِسِيمَاهُمْ ۚ وَنَادَوْا أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ أَن سَلَامٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۚ لَمْ يَدْخُلُوهَا وَهُمْ يَطْمَعُونَ
1000.verse-english: And between them will be a partition, and on [its] elevations are men who recognize all by their mark. And they call out to the companions of Paradise, "Peace be upon you." They have not [yet] entered it, but they long intensely.

clauses-english.clause: And between them will be a partition,
and on [its] elevations are men who recognize all by their mark.
And they call out to the companions of Paradise,
"Peace be upon you.
" They have not [yet] entered it,
but they long intensely.

1001.verse-arabic: ۞ وَإِذَا صُرِفَتْ أَبْصَارُهُمْ تِلْقَاءَ أَصْحَابِ النَّارِ قَالُوا رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا مَعَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
1001.verse-english: And when their eyes are turned toward the companions of the Fire, they say, "Our Lord, do not place us with the wrongdoing people."

clauses-english.clause: And when their eyes are turned toward the companions of the Fire,
they say,
"Our Lord,
do not place us with the wrongdoing people.

1002.verse-arabic: وَنَادَىٰ أَصْحَابُ الْأَعْرَافِ رِجَالًا يَعْرِفُونَهُم بِسِيمَاهُمْ قَالُوا مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنكُمْ جَمْعُكُمْ وَمَا كُنتُمْ تَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
1002.verse-english: And the companions of the Elevations will call to men [within Hell] whom they recognize by their mark, saying, "Of no avail to you was your gathering and [the fact] that you were arrogant."

clauses-english.clause: And the companions of the Elevations will call to men [within Hell] whom they recognize by their mark,
saying,
"Of no avail to you was your gathering and [the fact] that you were arrogant.

1003.verse-arabic: أَهَٰؤُلَاءِ الَّذِينَ أَقْسَمْتُمْ لَا يَنَالُهُمُ اللَّهُ بِرَحْمَةٍ ۚ ادْخُلُوا الْجَنَّةَ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَا أَنتُمْ تَحْزَنُونَ
1003.verse-english: [Allah will say], "Are these the ones whom you [inhabitants of Hell] swore that Allah would never offer them mercy? Enter Paradise, [O People of the Elevations]. No fear will there be concerning you, nor will you grieve."

clauses-english.clause: [God will say],
"Are these the ones whom you [inhabitants of Hell] swore that God would never offer them mercy?
Enter Paradise,
[O People of the Elevations].
No fear will there be concerning you,
nor will you grieve.

1004.verse-arabic: وَنَادَىٰ أَصْحَابُ النَّارِ أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ أَنْ أَفِيضُوا عَلَيْنَا مِنَ الْمَاءِ أَوْ مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ اللَّهُ ۚ قَالُوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ حَرَّمَهُمَا عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ
1004.verse-english: And the companions of the Fire will call to the companions of Paradise, "Pour upon us some water or from whatever Allah has provided you." They will say, "Indeed, Allah has forbidden them both to the disbelievers."

clauses-english.clause: And the companions of the Fire will call to the companions of Paradise,
"Pour upon us some water or from whatever God has provided you.
" They will say,
"Indeed,
God has forbidden them both to the disbelievers.

1005.verse-arabic: الَّذِينَ اتَّخَذُوا دِينَهُمْ لَهْوًا وَلَعِبًا وَغَرَّتْهُمُ الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا ۚ فَالْيَوْمَ نَنسَاهُمْ كَمَا نَسُوا لِقَاءَ يَوْمِهِمْ هَٰذَا وَمَا كَانُوا بِآيَاتِنَا يَجْحَدُونَ
1005.verse-english: Who took their religion as distraction and amusement and whom the worldly life deluded." So today We will forget them just as they forgot the meeting of this Day of theirs and for having rejected Our verses.

clauses-english.clause: Who took their religion as distraction and amusement and whom the worldly life deluded.
" So today We will forget them just as they forgot the meeting of this Day of theirs and for having rejected Our verses.

1006.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ جِئْنَاهُم بِكِتَابٍ فَصَّلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍ هُدًى وَرَحْمَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
1006.verse-english: And We had certainly brought them a Book which We detailed by knowledge - as guidance and mercy to a people who believe.

clauses-english.clause: And We had certainly brought them a Book which We detailed by knowledge -
as guidance and mercy to a people who believe.

1007.verse-arabic: هَلْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا تَأْوِيلَهُ ۚ يَوْمَ يَأْتِي تَأْوِيلُهُ يَقُولُ الَّذِينَ نَسُوهُ مِن قَبْلُ قَدْ جَاءَتْ رُسُلُ رَبِّنَا بِالْحَقِّ فَهَل لَّنَا مِن شُفَعَاءَ فَيَشْفَعُوا لَنَا أَوْ نُرَدُّ فَنَعْمَلَ غَيْرَ الَّذِي كُنَّا نَعْمَلُ ۚ قَدْ خَسِرُوا أَنفُسَهُمْ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يَفْتَرُونَ
1007.verse-english: Do they await except its result? The Day its result comes those who had ignored it before will say, "The messengers of our Lord had come with the truth, so are there [now] any intercessors to intercede for us or could we be sent back to do other than we used to do?" They will have lost themselves, and lost from them is what they used to invent.

clauses-english.clause: Do they await except its result?
The Day its result comes those who had ignored it before will say,
"The messengers of our Lord had come with the truth,
so are there [now] any intercessors to intercede for us or could we be sent back to do other than we used to do?
" They will have lost themselves,
and lost from them is what they used to invent.

1008.verse-arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ اللَّهُ الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ اسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ يُغْشِي اللَّيْلَ النَّهَارَ يَطْلُبُهُ حَثِيثًا وَالشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ وَالنُّجُومَ مُسَخَّرَاتٍ بِأَمْرِهِ ۗ أَلَا لَهُ الْخَلْقُ وَالْأَمْرُ ۗ تَبَارَكَ اللَّهُ رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ
1008.verse-english: Indeed, your Lord is Allah, who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He covers the night with the day, [another night] chasing it rapidly; and [He created] the sun, the moon, and the stars, subjected by His command. Unquestionably, His is the creation and the command; blessed is Allah, Lord of the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
your Lord is God,
who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne.
He covers the night with the day,
[another night] chasing it rapidly;
and [He created] the sun,
the moon,
and the stars,
subjected by His command.
Unquestionably,
His is the creation and the command;
blessed is God,
Lord of the worlds.

1009.verse-arabic: ادْعُوا رَبَّكُمْ تَضَرُّعًا وَخُفْيَةً ۚ إِنَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ الْمُعْتَدِينَ
1009.verse-english: Call upon your Lord in humility and privately; indeed, He does not like transgressors.

clauses-english.clause: Call upon your Lord in humility and privately;
indeed,
He does not like transgressors.

1010.verse-arabic: وَلَا تُفْسِدُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ بَعْدَ إِصْلَاحِهَا وَادْعُوهُ خَوْفًا وَطَمَعًا ۚ إِنَّ رَحْمَتَ اللَّهِ قَرِيبٌ مِّنَ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
1010.verse-english: And cause not corruption upon the earth after its reformation. And invoke Him in fear and aspiration. Indeed, the mercy of Allah is near to the doers of good.

clauses-english.clause: And cause not corruption upon the earth after its reformation.
And invoke Him in fear and aspiration.
Indeed,
the mercy of God is near to the doers of good.

1011.verse-arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي يُرْسِلُ الرِّيَاحَ بُشْرًا بَيْنَ يَدَيْ رَحْمَتِهِ ۖ حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَقَلَّتْ سَحَابًا ثِقَالًا سُقْنَاهُ لِبَلَدٍ مَّيِّتٍ فَأَنزَلْنَا بِهِ الْمَاءَ فَأَخْرَجْنَا بِهِ مِن كُلِّ الثَّمَرَاتِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نُخْرِجُ الْمَوْتَىٰ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
1011.verse-english: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy until, when they have carried heavy rainclouds, We drive them to a dead land and We send down rain therein and bring forth thereby [some] of all the fruits. Thus will We bring forth the dead; perhaps you may be reminded.

clauses-english.clause: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy until,
when they have carried heavy rainclouds,
We drive them to a dead land and We send down rain therein and bring forth thereby [some] of all the fruits.
Thus will We bring forth the dead;
perhaps you may be reminded.

1012.verse-arabic: وَالْبَلَدُ الطَّيِّبُ يَخْرُجُ نَبَاتُهُ بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِ ۖ وَالَّذِي خَبُثَ لَا يَخْرُجُ إِلَّا نَكِدًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نُصَرِّفُ الْآيَاتِ لِقَوْمٍ يَشْكُرُونَ
1012.verse-english: And the good land - its vegetation emerges by permission of its Lord; but that which is bad - nothing emerges except sparsely, with difficulty. Thus do We diversify the signs for a people who are grateful.

clauses-english.clause: And the good land -
its vegetation emerges by permission of its Lord;
but that which is bad -
nothing emerges except sparsely,
with difficulty.
Thus do We diversify the signs for a people who are grateful.

1013.verse-arabic: لَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ فَقَالَ يَا قَوْمِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرُهُ إِنِّي أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
1013.verse-english: We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day.

clauses-english.clause: We had certainly sent Noah to his people,
and he said,
"O my people,
worship God;
you have no deity other than Him.
Indeed,
I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day.

1014.verse-arabic: قَالَ الْمَلَأُ مِن قَوْمِهِ إِنَّا لَنَرَاكَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
1014.verse-english: Said the eminent among his people, "Indeed, we see you in clear error."

clauses-english.clause: Said the eminent among his people,
"Indeed,
we see you in clear error.

1015.verse-arabic: قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ لَيْسَ بِي ضَلَالَةٌ وَلَٰكِنِّي رَسُولٌ مِّن رَّبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
1015.verse-english: [Noah] said, "O my people, there is not error in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds."

clauses-english.clause: [Noah] said,
"O my people,
there is not error in me,
but I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds.

1016.verse-arabic: أُبَلِّغُكُمْ رِسَالَاتِ رَبِّي وَأَنصَحُ لَكُمْ وَأَعْلَمُ مِنَ اللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
1016.verse-english: I convey to you the messages of my Lord and advise you; and I know from Allah what you do not know.

clauses-english.clause: I convey to you the messages of my Lord and advise you;
and I know from God what you do not know.

1017.verse-arabic: أَوَعَجِبْتُمْ أَن جَاءَكُمْ ذِكْرٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَلَىٰ رَجُلٍ مِّنكُمْ لِيُنذِرَكُمْ وَلِتَتَّقُوا وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
1017.verse-english: Then do you wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your Lord through a man from among you, that he may warn you and that you may fear Allah so you might receive mercy."

clauses-english.clause: Then do you wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your Lord through a man from among you,
that he may warn you and that you may fear God so you might receive mercy.

1018.verse-arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَنجَيْنَاهُ وَالَّذِينَ مَعَهُ فِي الْفُلْكِ وَأَغْرَقْنَا الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا عَمِينَ
1018.verse-english: But they denied him, so We saved him and those who were with him in the ship. And We drowned those who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a blind people.

clauses-english.clause: But they denied him,
so We saved him and those who were with him in the ship.
And We drowned those who denied Our signs.
Indeed,
they were a blind people.

1019.verse-arabic: ۞ وَإِلَىٰ عَادٍ أَخَاهُمْ هُودًا ۗ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرُهُ ۚ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
1019.verse-english: And to the 'Aad [We sent] their brother Hud. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Then will you not fear Him?"

clauses-english.clause: And to the 'Aad [We sent] their brother Hud.
He said,
"O my people,
worship God;
you have no deity other than Him.
Then will you not fear Him?

1020.verse-arabic: قَالَ الْمَلَأُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِن قَوْمِهِ إِنَّا لَنَرَاكَ فِي سَفَاهَةٍ وَإِنَّا لَنَظُنُّكَ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
1020.verse-english: Said the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people, "Indeed, we see you in foolishness, and indeed, we think you are of the liars."

clauses-english.clause: Said the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people,
"Indeed,
we see you in foolishness,
and indeed,
we think you are of the liars.

1021.verse-arabic: قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ لَيْسَ بِي سَفَاهَةٌ وَلَٰكِنِّي رَسُولٌ مِّن رَّبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
1021.verse-english: [Hud] said, "O my people, there is not foolishness in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds."

clauses-english.clause: [Hud] said,
"O my people,
there is not foolishness in me,
but I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds.

1022.verse-arabic: أُبَلِّغُكُمْ رِسَالَاتِ رَبِّي وَأَنَا لَكُمْ نَاصِحٌ أَمِينٌ
1022.verse-english: I convey to you the messages of my Lord, and I am to you a trustworthy adviser.

clauses-english.clause: I convey to you the messages of my Lord,
and I am to you a trustworthy adviser.

1023.verse-arabic: أَوَعَجِبْتُمْ أَن جَاءَكُمْ ذِكْرٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَلَىٰ رَجُلٍ مِّنكُمْ لِيُنذِرَكُمْ ۚ وَاذْكُرُوا إِذْ جَعَلَكُمْ خُلَفَاءَ مِن بَعْدِ قَوْمِ نُوحٍ وَزَادَكُمْ فِي الْخَلْقِ بَسْطَةً ۖ فَاذْكُرُوا آلَاءَ اللَّهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
1023.verse-english: Then do you wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your Lord through a man from among you, that he may warn you? And remember when He made you successors after the people of Noah and increased you in stature extensively. So remember the favors of Allah that you might succeed.

clauses-english.clause: Then do you wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your Lord through a man from among you,
that he may warn you?
And remember when He made you successors after the people of Noah and increased you in stature extensively.
So remember the favors of God that you might succeed.

1024.verse-arabic: قَالُوا أَجِئْتَنَا لِنَعْبُدَ اللَّهَ وَحْدَهُ وَنَذَرَ مَا كَانَ يَعْبُدُ آبَاؤُنَا ۖ فَأْتِنَا بِمَا تَعِدُنَا إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
1024.verse-english: They said, "Have you come to us that we should worship Allah alone and leave what our fathers have worshipped? Then bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the truthful."

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"Have you come to us that we should worship God alone and leave what our fathers have worshipped?
Then bring us what you promise us,
if you should be of the truthful.

1025.verse-arabic: قَالَ قَدْ وَقَعَ عَلَيْكُم مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ رِجْسٌ وَغَضَبٌ ۖ أَتُجَادِلُونَنِي فِي أَسْمَاءٍ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَا أَنتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُم مَّا نَزَّلَ اللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلْطَانٍ ۚ فَانتَظِرُوا إِنِّي مَعَكُم مِّنَ الْمُنتَظِرِينَ
1025.verse-english: [Hud] said, "Already have defilement and anger fallen upon you from your Lord. Do you dispute with me concerning [mere] names you have named them, you and your fathers, for which Allah has not sent down any authority? Then wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait."

clauses-english.clause: [Hud] said,
"Already have defilement and anger fallen upon you from your Lord.
Do you dispute with me concerning [mere] names you have named them,
you and your fathers,
for which God has not sent down any authority?
Then wait;
indeed,
I am with you among those who wait.

1026.verse-arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَاهُ وَالَّذِينَ مَعَهُ بِرَحْمَةٍ مِّنَّا وَقَطَعْنَا دَابِرَ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا ۖ وَمَا كَانُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ
1026.verse-english: So We saved him and those with him by mercy from Us. And We eliminated those who denied Our signs, and they were not [at all] believers.

clauses-english.clause: So We saved him and those with him by mercy from Us.
And We eliminated those who denied Our signs,
and they were not [at all] believers.

1027.verse-arabic: وَإِلَىٰ ثَمُودَ أَخَاهُمْ صَالِحًا ۗ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرُهُ ۖ قَدْ جَاءَتْكُم بَيِّنَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ هَٰذِهِ نَاقَةُ اللَّهِ لَكُمْ آيَةً ۖ فَذَرُوهَا تَأْكُلْ فِي أَرْضِ اللَّهِ ۖ وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
1027.verse-english: And to the Thamud [We sent] their brother Salih. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord. This is the she-camel of Allah [sent] to you as a sign. So leave her to eat within Allah 's land and do not touch her with harm, lest there seize you a painful punishment.

clauses-english.clause: And to the Thamud [We sent] their brother Salih.
He said,
"O my people,
worship God;
you have no deity other than Him.
There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord.
This is the she-
camel of God [sent] to you as a sign.
So leave her to eat within God 's land and do not touch her with harm,
lest there seize you a painful punishment.

1028.verse-arabic: وَاذْكُرُوا إِذْ جَعَلَكُمْ خُلَفَاءَ مِن بَعْدِ عَادٍ وَبَوَّأَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ تَتَّخِذُونَ مِن سُهُولِهَا قُصُورًا وَتَنْحِتُونَ الْجِبَالَ بُيُوتًا ۖ فَاذْكُرُوا آلَاءَ اللَّهِ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا فِي الْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
1028.verse-english: And remember when He made you successors after the 'Aad and settled you in the land, [and] you take for yourselves palaces from its plains and carve from the mountains, homes. Then remember the favors of Allah and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."

clauses-english.clause: And remember when He made you successors after the 'Aad and settled you in the land,
[and] you take for yourselves palaces from its plains and carve from the mountains,
homes.
Then remember the favors of God and do not commit abuse on the earth,
spreading corruption.

1029.verse-arabic: قَالَ الْمَلَأُ الَّذِينَ اسْتَكْبَرُوا مِن قَوْمِهِ لِلَّذِينَ اسْتُضْعِفُوا لِمَنْ آمَنَ مِنْهُمْ أَتَعْلَمُونَ أَنَّ صَالِحًا مُّرْسَلٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِ ۚ قَالُوا إِنَّا بِمَا أُرْسِلَ بِهِ مُؤْمِنُونَ
1029.verse-english: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people to those who were oppressed - to those who believed among them, "Do you [actually] know that Salih is sent from his Lord?" They said, "Indeed we, in that with which he was sent, are believers."

clauses-english.clause: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people to those who were oppressed -
to those who believed among them,
"Do you [actually] know that Salih is sent from his Lord?
" They said,
"Indeed we,
in that with which he was sent,
are believers.

1030.verse-arabic: قَالَ الَّذِينَ اسْتَكْبَرُوا إِنَّا بِالَّذِي آمَنتُم بِهِ كَافِرُونَ
1030.verse-english: Said those who were arrogant, "Indeed we, in that which you have believed, are disbelievers."

clauses-english.clause: Said those who were arrogant,
"Indeed we,
in that which you have believed,
are disbelievers.

1031.verse-arabic: فَعَقَرُوا النَّاقَةَ وَعَتَوْا عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ وَقَالُوا يَا صَالِحُ ائْتِنَا بِمَا تَعِدُنَا إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
1031.verse-english: So they hamstrung the she-camel and were insolent toward the command of their Lord and said, "O Salih, bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the messengers."

clauses-english.clause: So they hamstrung the she-
camel and were insolent toward the command of their Lord and said,
"O Salih,
bring us what you promise us,
if you should be of the messengers.

1032.verse-arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الرَّجْفَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا فِي دَارِهِمْ جَاثِمِينَ
1032.verse-english: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.

clauses-english.clause: So the earthquake seized them,
and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.

1033.verse-arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ عَنْهُمْ وَقَالَ يَا قَوْمِ لَقَدْ أَبْلَغْتُكُمْ رِسَالَةَ رَبِّي وَنَصَحْتُ لَكُمْ وَلَٰكِن لَّا تُحِبُّونَ النَّاصِحِينَ
1033.verse-english: And he turned away from them and said, "O my people, I had certainly conveyed to you the message of my Lord and advised you, but you do not like advisors."

clauses-english.clause: And he turned away from them and said,
"O my people,
I had certainly conveyed to you the message of my Lord and advised you,
but you do not like advisors.

1034.verse-arabic: وَلُوطًا إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِ أَتَأْتُونَ الْفَاحِشَةَ مَا سَبَقَكُم بِهَا مِنْ أَحَدٍ مِّنَ الْعَالَمِينَ
1034.verse-english: And [We had sent] Lot when he said to his people, "Do you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds?

clauses-english.clause: And [We had sent] Lot when he said to his people,
"Do you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds?

1035.verse-arabic: إِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ الرِّجَالَ شَهْوَةً مِّن دُونِ النِّسَاءِ ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ مُّسْرِفُونَ
1035.verse-english: Indeed, you approach men with desire, instead of women. Rather, you are a transgressing people."

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
you approach men with desire,
instead of women.
Rather,
you are a transgressing people.

1036.verse-arabic: وَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِ إِلَّا أَن قَالُوا أَخْرِجُوهُم مِّن قَرْيَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ أُنَاسٌ يَتَطَهَّرُونَ
1036.verse-english: But the answer of his people was only that they said, "Evict them from your city! Indeed, they are men who keep themselves pure."

clauses-english.clause: But the answer of his people was only that they said,
"Evict them from your city!
Indeed,
they are men who keep themselves pure.

1037.verse-arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ إِلَّا امْرَأَتَهُ كَانَتْ مِنَ الْغَابِرِينَ
1037.verse-english: So We saved him and his family, except for his wife; she was of those who remained [with the evildoers].

clauses-english.clause: So We saved him and his family,
except for his wife;
she was of those who remained [with the evildoers].

1038.verse-arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَانظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُجْرِمِينَ
1038.verse-english: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones]. Then see how was the end of the criminals.

clauses-english.clause: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones].
Then see how was the end of the criminals.

1039.verse-arabic: وَإِلَىٰ مَدْيَنَ أَخَاهُمْ شُعَيْبًا ۗ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرُهُ ۖ قَدْ جَاءَتْكُم بَيِّنَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ فَأَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ وَالْمِيزَانَ وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا النَّاسَ أَشْيَاءَهُمْ وَلَا تُفْسِدُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ بَعْدَ إِصْلَاحِهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
1039.verse-english: And to [the people of] Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord. So fulfill the measure and weight and do not deprive people of their due and cause not corruption upon the earth after its reformation. That is better for you, if you should be believers.

clauses-english.clause: And to [the people of] Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb.
He said,
"O my people,
worship God;
you have no deity other than Him.
There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord.
So fulfill the measure and weight and do not deprive people of their due and cause not corruption upon the earth after its reformation.
That is better for you,
if you should be believers.

1040.verse-arabic: وَلَا تَقْعُدُوا بِكُلِّ صِرَاطٍ تُوعِدُونَ وَتَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ مَنْ آمَنَ بِهِ وَتَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًا ۚ وَاذْكُرُوا إِذْ كُنتُمْ قَلِيلًا فَكَثَّرَكُمْ ۖ وَانظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُفْسِدِينَ
1040.verse-english: And do not sit on every path, threatening and averting from the way of Allah those who believe in Him, seeking to make it [seem] deviant. And remember when you were few and He increased you. And see how was the end of the corrupters.

clauses-english.clause: And do not sit on every path,
threatening and averting from the way of God those who believe in Him,
seeking to make it [seem] deviant.
And remember when you were few and He increased you.
And see how was the end of the corrupters.

1041.verse-arabic: وَإِن كَانَ طَائِفَةٌ مِّنكُمْ آمَنُوا بِالَّذِي أُرْسِلْتُ بِهِ وَطَائِفَةٌ لَّمْ يُؤْمِنُوا فَاصْبِرُوا حَتَّىٰ يَحْكُمَ اللَّهُ بَيْنَنَا ۚ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ الْحَاكِمِينَ
1041.verse-english: And if there should be a group among you who has believed in that with which I have been sent and a group that has not believed, then be patient until Allah judges between us. And He is the best of judges."

clauses-english.clause: And if there should be a group among you who has believed in that with which I have been sent and a group that has not believed,
then be patient until God judges between us.
And He is the best of judges.

1042.verse-arabic: ۞ قَالَ الْمَلَأُ الَّذِينَ اسْتَكْبَرُوا مِن قَوْمِهِ لَنُخْرِجَنَّكَ يَا شُعَيْبُ وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مَعَكَ مِن قَرْيَتِنَا أَوْ لَتَعُودُنَّ فِي مِلَّتِنَا ۚ قَالَ أَوَلَوْ كُنَّا كَارِهِينَ
1042.verse-english: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people, "We will surely evict you, O Shu'ayb, and those who have believed with you from our city, or you must return to our religion." He said, "Even if we were unwilling?"

clauses-english.clause: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people,
"We will surely evict you,
O Shu'ayb,
and those who have believed with you from our city,
or you must return to our religion.
" He said,
"Even if we were unwilling?

1043.verse-arabic: قَدِ افْتَرَيْنَا عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا إِنْ عُدْنَا فِي مِلَّتِكُم بَعْدَ إِذْ نَجَّانَا اللَّهُ مِنْهَا ۚ وَمَا يَكُونُ لَنَا أَن نَّعُودَ فِيهَا إِلَّا أَن يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ رَبُّنَا ۚ وَسِعَ رَبُّنَا كُلَّ شَيْءٍ عِلْمًا ۚ عَلَى اللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا افْتَحْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَ قَوْمِنَا بِالْحَقِّ وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الْفَاتِحِينَ
1043.verse-english: We would have invented against Allah a lie if we returned to your religion after Allah had saved us from it. And it is not for us to return to it except that Allah, our Lord, should will. Our Lord has encompassed all things in knowledge. Upon Allah we have relied. Our Lord, decide between us and our people in truth, and You are the best of those who give decision."

clauses-english.clause: We would have invented against God a lie if we returned to your religion after God had saved us from it.
And it is not for us to return to it except that God,
our Lord,
should will.
Our Lord has encompassed all things in knowledge.
Upon God we have relied.
Our Lord,
decide between us and our people in truth,
and You are the best of those who give decision.

1044.verse-arabic: وَقَالَ الْمَلَأُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِن قَوْمِهِ لَئِنِ اتَّبَعْتُمْ شُعَيْبًا إِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّخَاسِرُونَ
1044.verse-english: Said the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people, "If you should follow Shu'ayb, indeed, you would then be losers."

clauses-english.clause: Said the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people,
"If you should follow Shu'ayb,
indeed,
you would then be losers.

1045.verse-arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الرَّجْفَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا فِي دَارِهِمْ جَاثِمِينَ
1045.verse-english: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.

clauses-english.clause: So the earthquake seized them,
and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.

1046.verse-arabic: الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا شُعَيْبًا كَأَن لَّمْ يَغْنَوْا فِيهَا ۚ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا شُعَيْبًا كَانُوا هُمُ الْخَاسِرِينَ
1046.verse-english: Those who denied Shu'ayb - it was as though they had never resided there. Those who denied Shu'ayb - it was they who were the losers.

clauses-english.clause: Those who denied Shu'ayb -
it was as though they had never resided there.
Those who denied Shu'ayb -
it was they who were the losers.

1047.verse-arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ عَنْهُمْ وَقَالَ يَا قَوْمِ لَقَدْ أَبْلَغْتُكُمْ رِسَالَاتِ رَبِّي وَنَصَحْتُ لَكُمْ ۖ فَكَيْفَ آسَىٰ عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍ كَافِرِينَ
1047.verse-english: And he turned away from them and said, "O my people, I had certainly conveyed to you the messages of my Lord and advised you, so how could I grieve for a disbelieving people?"

clauses-english.clause: And he turned away from them and said,
"O my people,
I had certainly conveyed to you the messages of my Lord and advised you,
so how could I grieve for a disbelieving people?

1048.verse-arabic: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا فِي قَرْيَةٍ مِّن نَّبِيٍّ إِلَّا أَخَذْنَا أَهْلَهَا بِالْبَأْسَاءِ وَالضَّرَّاءِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَضَّرَّعُونَ
1048.verse-english: And We sent to no city a prophet [who was denied] except that We seized its people with poverty and hardship that they might humble themselves [to Allah].

clauses-arabic.clause: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا فِي قَرْيَةٍ مِّن نَّبِيٍّ إِلَّا أَخَذْنَا أَهْلَهَا بِالْبَأْسَاءِ وَالضَّرَّاءِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَضَّرَّعُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And We sent to no city a prophet [who was denied] except that We seized its people with poverty and hardship that they might humble themselves [to God].

1049.verse-arabic: ثُمَّ بَدَّلْنَا مَكَانَ السَّيِّئَةِ الْحَسَنَةَ حَتَّىٰ عَفَوا وَّقَالُوا قَدْ مَسَّ آبَاءَنَا الضَّرَّاءُ وَالسَّرَّاءُ فَأَخَذْنَاهُم بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
1049.verse-english: Then We exchanged in place of the bad [condition], good, until they increased [and prospered] and said, "Our fathers [also] were touched with hardship and ease." So We seized them suddenly while they did not perceive.

clauses-english.clause: Then We exchanged in place of the bad [condition],
good,
until they increased [and prospered] and said,
"Our fathers [also] were touched with hardship and ease.
" So We seized them suddenly while they did not perceive.

1050.verse-arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّ أَهْلَ الْقُرَىٰ آمَنُوا وَاتَّقَوْا لَفَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَرَكَاتٍ مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَلَٰكِن كَذَّبُوا فَأَخَذْنَاهُم بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
1050.verse-english: And if only the people of the cities had believed and feared Allah, We would have opened upon them blessings from the heaven and the earth; but they denied [the messengers], so We seized them for what they were earning."

clauses-english.clause: And if only the people of the cities had believed and feared God,
We would have opened upon them blessings from the heaven and the earth;
but they denied [the messengers],
so We seized them for what they were earning.

1051.verse-arabic: أَفَأَمِنَ أَهْلُ الْقُرَىٰ أَن يَأْتِيَهُم بَأْسُنَا بَيَاتًا وَهُمْ نَائِمُونَ
1051.verse-english: Then, did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them at night while they were asleep?

clauses-english.clause: Then,
did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them at night while they were asleep?

1052.verse-arabic: أَوَأَمِنَ أَهْلُ الْقُرَىٰ أَن يَأْتِيَهُم بَأْسُنَا ضُحًى وَهُمْ يَلْعَبُونَ
1052.verse-english: Or did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them in the morning while they were at play?

clauses-arabic.clause: أَوَأَمِنَ أَهْلُ الْقُرَىٰ أَن يَأْتِيَهُم بَأْسُنَا ضُحًى وَهُمْ يَلْعَبُونَ

clauses-english.clause: Or did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them in the morning while they were at play?

1053.verse-arabic: أَفَأَمِنُوا مَكْرَ اللَّهِ ۚ فَلَا يَأْمَنُ مَكْرَ اللَّهِ إِلَّا الْقَوْمُ الْخَاسِرُونَ
1053.verse-english: Then did they feel secure from the plan of Allah? But no one feels secure from the plan of Allah except the losing people.

clauses-english.clause: Then did they feel secure from the plan of God?
But no one feels secure from the plan of God except the losing people.

1054.verse-arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَهْدِ لِلَّذِينَ يَرِثُونَ الْأَرْضَ مِن بَعْدِ أَهْلِهَا أَن لَّوْ نَشَاءُ أَصَبْنَاهُم بِذُنُوبِهِمْ ۚ وَنَطْبَعُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ فَهُمْ لَا يَسْمَعُونَ
1054.verse-english: Has it not become clear to those who inherited the earth after its [previous] people that if We willed, We could afflict them for their sins? But We seal over their hearts so they do not hear.

clauses-english.clause: Has it not become clear to those who inherited the earth after its [previous] people that if We willed,
We could afflict them for their sins?
But We seal over their hearts so they do not hear.

1055.verse-arabic: تِلْكَ الْقُرَىٰ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ أَنبَائِهَا ۚ وَلَقَدْ جَاءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ فَمَا كَانُوا لِيُؤْمِنُوا بِمَا كَذَّبُوا مِن قَبْلُ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَطْبَعُ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِ الْكَافِرِينَ
1055.verse-english: Those cities - We relate to you, [O Muhammad], some of their news. And certainly did their messengers come to them with clear proofs, but they were not to believe in that which they had denied before. Thus does Allah seal over the hearts of the disbelievers.

clauses-english.clause: Those cities -
We relate to you,
[O Muhammad],
some of their news.
And certainly did their messengers come to them with clear proofs,
but they were not to believe in that which they had denied before.
Thus does God seal over the hearts of the disbelievers.

1056.verse-arabic: وَمَا وَجَدْنَا لِأَكْثَرِهِم مِّنْ عَهْدٍ ۖ وَإِن وَجَدْنَا أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَفَاسِقِينَ
1056.verse-english: And We did not find for most of them any covenant; but indeed, We found most of them defiantly disobedient.

clauses-english.clause: And We did not find for most of them any covenant;
but indeed,
We found most of them defiantly disobedient.

1057.verse-arabic: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَا مِن بَعْدِهِم مُّوسَىٰ بِآيَاتِنَا إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَئِهِ فَظَلَمُوا بِهَا ۖ فَانظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُفْسِدِينَ
1057.verse-english: Then We sent after them Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were unjust toward them. So see how was the end of the corrupters.

clauses-english.clause: Then We sent after them Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment,
but they were unjust toward them.
So see how was the end of the corrupters.

1058.verse-arabic: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ يَا فِرْعَوْنُ إِنِّي رَسُولٌ مِّن رَّبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
1058.verse-english: And Moses said, "O Pharaoh, I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds

clauses-english.clause: And Moses said,
"O Pharaoh,
I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds

1059.verse-arabic: حَقِيقٌ عَلَىٰ أَن لَّا أَقُولَ عَلَى اللَّهِ إِلَّا الْحَقَّ ۚ قَدْ جِئْتُكُم بِبَيِّنَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ فَأَرْسِلْ مَعِيَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
1059.verse-english: [Who is] obligated not to say about Allah except the truth. I have come to you with clear evidence from your Lord, so send with me the Children of Israel."

clauses-english.clause: [Who is] obligated not to say about God except the truth.
I have come to you with clear evidence from your Lord,
so send with me the Children of Israel.

1060.verse-arabic: قَالَ إِن كُنتَ جِئْتَ بِآيَةٍ فَأْتِ بِهَا إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
1060.verse-english: [Pharaoh] said, "If you have come with a sign, then bring it forth, if you should be of the truthful."

clauses-english.clause: [Pharaoh] said,
"If you have come with a sign,
then bring it forth,
if you should be of the truthful.

1061.verse-arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
1061.verse-english: So Moses threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent, manifest.

clauses-english.clause: So Moses threw his staff,
and suddenly it was a serpent,
manifest.

1062.verse-arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيْضَاءُ لِلنَّاظِرِينَ
1062.verse-english: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white [with radiance] for the observers.

clauses-english.clause: And he drew out his hand;
thereupon it was white [with radiance] for the observers.

1063.verse-arabic: قَالَ الْمَلَأُ مِن قَوْمِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَاحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
1063.verse-english: Said the eminent among the people of Pharaoh, "Indeed, this is a learned magician

clauses-english.clause: Said the eminent among the people of Pharaoh,
"Indeed,
this is a learned magician

1064.verse-arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُمْ ۖ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
1064.verse-english: Who wants to expel you from your land [through magic], so what do you instruct?"

clauses-english.clause: Who wants to expel you from your land [through magic],
so what do you instruct?

1065.verse-arabic: قَالُوا أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَأَرْسِلْ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ
1065.verse-english: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers

1066.verse-english: Who will bring you every learned magician."

clauses-english.clause: Who will bring you every learned magician.

1067.verse-arabic: وَجَاءَ السَّحَرَةُ فِرْعَوْنَ قَالُوا إِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ الْغَالِبِينَ
1067.verse-english: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, "Indeed for us is a reward if we are the predominant."

clauses-english.clause: And the magicians came to Pharaoh.
They said,
"Indeed for us is a reward if we are the predominant.

1068.verse-english: He said, "Yes, and, [moreover], you will be among those made near [to me]."

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"Yes,
and,
[moreover],
you will be among those made near [to me].

1069.verse-arabic: قَالُوا يَا مُوسَىٰ إِمَّا أَن تُلْقِيَ وَإِمَّا أَن نَّكُونَ نَحْنُ الْمُلْقِينَ
1069.verse-english: They said, "O Moses, either you throw [your staff], or we will be the ones to throw [first]."

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"O Moses,
either you throw [your staff],
or we will be the ones to throw [first].

1070.verse-arabic: قَالَ أَلْقُوا ۖ فَلَمَّا أَلْقَوْا سَحَرُوا أَعْيُنَ النَّاسِ وَاسْتَرْهَبُوهُمْ وَجَاءُوا بِسِحْرٍ عَظِيمٍ
1070.verse-english: He said, "Throw," and when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people and struck terror into them, and they presented a great [feat of] magic.

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"Throw,
" and when they threw,
they bewitched the eyes of the people and struck terror into them,
and they presented a great [feat of] magic.

1071.verse-arabic: ۞ وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۖ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
1071.verse-english: And We inspired to Moses, "Throw your staff," and at once it devoured what they were falsifying.

clauses-english.clause: And We inspired to Moses,
"Throw your staff,
" and at once it devoured what they were falsifying.

1072.verse-arabic: فَوَقَعَ الْحَقُّ وَبَطَلَ مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
1072.verse-english: So the truth was established, and abolished was what they were doing.

clauses-english.clause: So the truth was established,
and abolished was what they were doing.

1073.verse-english: And Pharaoh and his people were overcome right there and became debased.

clauses-english.clause: And Pharaoh and his people were overcome right there and became debased.

1074.verse-english: And the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allah].

clauses-english.clause: And the magicians fell down in prostration [to God].

1075.verse-english: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,

1076.verse-english: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

clauses-english.clause: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.

1077.verse-arabic: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ آمَنتُم بِهِ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَمَكْرٌ مَّكَرْتُمُوهُ فِي الْمَدِينَةِ لِتُخْرِجُوا مِنْهَا أَهْلَهَا ۖ فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
1077.verse-english: Said Pharaoh, "You believed in him before I gave you permission. Indeed, this is a conspiracy which you conspired in the city to expel therefrom its people. But you are going to know.

clauses-english.clause: Said Pharaoh,
"You believed in him before I gave you permission.
Indeed,
this is a conspiracy which you conspired in the city to expel therefrom its people.
But you are going to know.

1078.verse-arabic: لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَافٍ ثُمَّ لَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
1078.verse-english: I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides; then I will surely crucify you all."

clauses-english.clause: I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides;
then I will surely crucify you all.

1079.verse-english: They said, "Indeed, to our Lord we will return.

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"Indeed,
to our Lord we will return.

1080.verse-arabic: وَمَا تَنقِمُ مِنَّا إِلَّا أَنْ آمَنَّا بِآيَاتِ رَبِّنَا لَمَّا جَاءَتْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَتَوَفَّنَا مُسْلِمِينَ
1080.verse-english: And you do not resent us except because we believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us. Our Lord, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You]."

clauses-english.clause: And you do not resent us except because we believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us.
Our Lord,
pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You].

1081.verse-arabic: وَقَالَ الْمَلَأُ مِن قَوْمِ فِرْعَوْنَ أَتَذَرُ مُوسَىٰ وَقَوْمَهُ لِيُفْسِدُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَيَذَرَكَ وَآلِهَتَكَ ۚ قَالَ سَنُقَتِّلُ أَبْنَاءَهُمْ وَنَسْتَحْيِي نِسَاءَهُمْ وَإِنَّا فَوْقَهُمْ قَاهِرُونَ
1081.verse-english: And the eminent among the people of Pharaoh said," Will you leave Moses and his people to cause corruption in the land and abandon you and your gods?" [Pharaoh] said, "We will kill their sons and keep their women alive; and indeed, we are subjugators over them."

clauses-english.clause: And the eminent among the people of Pharaoh said,
" Will you leave Moses and his people to cause corruption in the land and abandon you and your gods?
" [Pharaoh] said,
"We will kill their sons and keep their women alive;
and indeed,
we are subjugators over them.

1082.verse-arabic: قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِ اسْتَعِينُوا بِاللَّهِ وَاصْبِرُوا ۖ إِنَّ الْأَرْضَ لِلَّهِ يُورِثُهَا مَن يَشَاءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ ۖ وَالْعَاقِبَةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
1082.verse-english: Said Moses to his people, "Seek help through Allah and be patient. Indeed, the earth belongs to Allah. He causes to inherit it whom He wills of His servants. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous."

clauses-english.clause: Said Moses to his people,
"Seek help through God and be patient.
Indeed,
the earth belongs to God.
He causes to inherit it whom He wills of His servants.
And the [best] outcome is for the righteous.

1083.verse-arabic: قَالُوا أُوذِينَا مِن قَبْلِ أَن تَأْتِيَنَا وَمِن بَعْدِ مَا جِئْتَنَا ۚ قَالَ عَسَىٰ رَبُّكُمْ أَن يُهْلِكَ عَدُوَّكُمْ وَيَسْتَخْلِفَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرَ كَيْفَ تَعْمَلُونَ
1083.verse-english: They said, "We have been harmed before you came to us and after you have come to us." He said, "Perhaps your Lord will destroy your enemy and grant you succession in the land and see how you will do."

clauses-english.clause: They said,
"We have been harmed before you came to us and after you have come to us.
" He said,
"Perhaps your Lord will destroy your enemy and grant you succession in the land and see how you will do.

1084.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَخَذْنَا آلَ فِرْعَوْنَ بِالسِّنِينَ وَنَقْصٍ مِّنَ الثَّمَرَاتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
1084.verse-english: And We certainly seized the people of Pharaoh with years of famine and a deficiency in fruits that perhaps they would be reminded.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَلَقَدْ أَخَذْنَا آلَ فِرْعَوْنَ بِالسِّنِينَ وَنَقْصٍ مِّنَ الثَّمَرَاتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَذَّكَّرُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And We certainly seized the people of Pharaoh with years of famine and a deficiency in fruits that perhaps they would be reminded.

1085.verse-arabic: فَإِذَا جَاءَتْهُمُ الْحَسَنَةُ قَالُوا لَنَا هَٰذِهِ ۖ وَإِن تُصِبْهُمْ سَيِّئَةٌ يَطَّيَّرُوا بِمُوسَىٰ وَمَن مَّعَهُ ۗ أَلَا إِنَّمَا طَائِرُهُمْ عِندَ اللَّهِ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
1085.verse-english: But when good came to them, they said, "This is ours [by right]." And if a bad [condition] struck them, they saw an evil omen in Moses and those with him. Unquestionably, their fortune is with Allah, but most of them do not know.

clauses-english.clause: But when good came to them,
they said,
"This is ours [by right].
" And if a bad [condition] struck them,
they saw an evil omen in Moses and those with him.
Unquestionably,
their fortune is with God,
but most of them do not know.

1086.verse-arabic: وَقَالُوا مَهْمَا تَأْتِنَا بِهِ مِنْ آيَةٍ لِّتَسْحَرَنَا بِهَا فَمَا نَحْنُ لَكَ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
1086.verse-english: And they said, "No matter what sign you bring us with which to bewitch us, we will not be believers in you."

clauses-english.clause: And they said,
"No matter what sign you bring us with which to bewitch us,
we will not be believers in you.

1087.verse-arabic: فَأَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الطُّوفَانَ وَالْجَرَادَ وَالْقُمَّلَ وَالضَّفَادِعَ وَالدَّمَ آيَاتٍ مُّفَصَّلَاتٍ فَاسْتَكْبَرُوا وَكَانُوا قَوْمًا مُّجْرِمِينَ
1087.verse-english: So We sent upon them the flood and locusts and lice and frogs and blood as distinct signs, but they were arrogant and were a criminal people.

clauses-english.clause: So We sent upon them the flood and locusts and lice and frogs and blood as distinct signs,
but they were arrogant and were a criminal people.

1088.verse-arabic: وَلَمَّا وَقَعَ عَلَيْهِمُ الرِّجْزُ قَالُوا يَا مُوسَى ادْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ بِمَا عَهِدَ عِندَكَ ۖ لَئِن كَشَفْتَ عَنَّا الرِّجْزَ لَنُؤْمِنَنَّ لَكَ وَلَنُرْسِلَنَّ مَعَكَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
1088.verse-english: And when the punishment descended upon them, they said, "O Moses, invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you. If you [can] remove the punishment from us, we will surely believe you, and we will send with you the Children of Israel."

clauses-english.clause: And when the punishment descended upon them,
they said,
"O Moses,
invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you.
If you [can] remove the punishment from us,
we will surely believe you,
and we will send with you the Children of Israel.

1089.verse-arabic: فَلَمَّا كَشَفْنَا عَنْهُمُ الرِّجْزَ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ هُم بَالِغُوهُ إِذَا هُمْ يَنكُثُونَ
1089.verse-english: But when We removed the punishment from them until a term which they were to reach, then at once they broke their word.

clauses-english.clause: But when We removed the punishment from them until a term which they were to reach,
then at once they broke their word.

1090.verse-arabic: فَانتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ فَأَغْرَقْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا وَكَانُوا عَنْهَا غَافِلِينَ
1090.verse-english: So We took retribution from them, and We drowned them in the sea because they denied Our signs and were heedless of them.

clauses-english.clause: So We took retribution from them,
and We drowned them in the sea because they denied Our signs and were heedless of them.

1091.verse-arabic: وَأَوْرَثْنَا الْقَوْمَ الَّذِينَ كَانُوا يُسْتَضْعَفُونَ مَشَارِقَ الْأَرْضِ وَمَغَارِبَهَا الَّتِي بَارَكْنَا فِيهَا ۖ وَتَمَّتْ كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ الْحُسْنَىٰ عَلَىٰ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا ۖ وَدَمَّرْنَا مَا كَانَ يَصْنَعُ فِرْعَوْنُ وَقَوْمُهُ وَمَا كَانُوا يَعْرِشُونَ
1091.verse-english: And We caused the people who had been oppressed to inherit the eastern regions of the land and the western ones, which We had blessed. And the good word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of what they had patiently endured. And We destroyed [all] that Pharaoh and his people were producing and what they had been building.

clauses-english.clause: And We caused the people who had been oppressed to inherit the eastern regions of the land and the western ones,
which We had blessed.
And the good word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of what they had patiently endured.
And We destroyed [all] that Pharaoh and his people were producing and what they had been building.

1092.verse-arabic: وَجَاوَزْنَا بِبَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ الْبَحْرَ فَأَتَوْا عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍ يَعْكُفُونَ عَلَىٰ أَصْنَامٍ لَّهُمْ ۚ قَالُوا يَا مُوسَى اجْعَل لَّنَا إِلَٰهًا كَمَا لَهُمْ آلِهَةٌ ۚ قَالَ إِنَّكُمْ قَوْمٌ تَجْهَلُونَ
1092.verse-english: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea; then they came upon a people intent in devotion to [some] idols of theirs. They said, "O Moses, make for us a god just as they have gods." He said, "Indeed, you are a people behaving ignorantly.

clauses-english.clause: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea;
then they came upon a people intent in devotion to [some] idols of theirs.
They said,
"O Moses,
make for us a god just as they have gods.
" He said,
"Indeed,
you are a people behaving ignorantly.

1093.verse-arabic: إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ مُتَبَّرٌ مَّا هُمْ فِيهِ وَبَاطِلٌ مَّا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
1093.verse-english: Indeed, those [worshippers] - destroyed is that in which they are [engaged], and worthless is whatever they were doing."

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
those [worshippers] -
destroyed is that in which they are [engaged],
and worthless is whatever they were doing.

1094.verse-arabic: قَالَ أَغَيْرَ اللَّهِ أَبْغِيكُمْ إِلَٰهًا وَهُوَ فَضَّلَكُمْ عَلَى الْعَالَمِينَ
1094.verse-english: He said, "Is it other than Allah I should desire for you as a god while He has preferred you over the worlds?"

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"Is it other than God I should desire for you as a god while He has preferred you over the worlds?

1095.verse-arabic: وَإِذْ أَنجَيْنَاكُم مِّنْ آلِ فِرْعَوْنَ يَسُومُونَكُمْ سُوءَ الْعَذَابِ ۖ يُقَتِّلُونَ أَبْنَاءَكُمْ وَيَسْتَحْيُونَ نِسَاءَكُمْ ۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكُم بَلَاءٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَظِيمٌ
1095.verse-english: And [recall, O Children of Israel], when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, [who were] afflicting you with the worst torment - killing your sons and keeping your women alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.

clauses-english.clause: And [recall,
O Children of Israel],
when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh,
[who were] afflicting you with the worst torment -
killing your sons and keeping your women alive.
And in that was a great trial from your Lord.

1096.verse-arabic: ۞ وَوَاعَدْنَا مُوسَىٰ ثَلَاثِينَ لَيْلَةً وَأَتْمَمْنَاهَا بِعَشْرٍ فَتَمَّ مِيقَاتُ رَبِّهِ أَرْبَعِينَ لَيْلَةً ۚ وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَخِيهِ هَارُونَ اخْلُفْنِي فِي قَوْمِي وَأَصْلِحْ وَلَا تَتَّبِعْ سَبِيلَ الْمُفْسِدِينَ
1096.verse-english: And We made an appointment with Moses for thirty nights and perfected them by [the addition of] ten; so the term of his Lord was completed as forty nights. And Moses said to his brother Aaron, "Take my place among my people, do right [by them], and do not follow the way of the corrupters."

clauses-english.clause: And We made an appointment with Moses for thirty nights and perfected them by [the addition of] ten;
so the term of his Lord was completed as forty nights.
And Moses said to his brother Aaron,
"Take my place among my people,
do right [by them],
and do not follow the way of the corrupters.

1097.verse-arabic: وَلَمَّا جَاءَ مُوسَىٰ لِمِيقَاتِنَا وَكَلَّمَهُ رَبُّهُ قَالَ رَبِّ أَرِنِي أَنظُرْ إِلَيْكَ ۚ قَالَ لَن تَرَانِي وَلَٰكِنِ انظُرْ إِلَى الْجَبَلِ فَإِنِ اسْتَقَرَّ مَكَانَهُ فَسَوْفَ تَرَانِي ۚ فَلَمَّا تَجَلَّىٰ رَبُّهُ لِلْجَبَلِ جَعَلَهُ دَكًّا وَخَرَّ مُوسَىٰ صَعِقًا ۚ فَلَمَّا أَفَاقَ قَالَ سُبْحَانَكَ تُبْتُ إِلَيْكَ وَأَنَا أَوَّلُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
1097.verse-english: And when Moses arrived at Our appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said, "My Lord, show me [Yourself] that I may look at You." [Allah] said, "You will not see Me, but look at the mountain; if it should remain in place, then you will see Me." But when his Lord appeared to the mountain, He rendered it level, and Moses fell unconscious. And when he awoke, he said, "Exalted are You! I have repented to You, and I am the first of the believers."

clauses-english.clause: And when Moses arrived at Our appointed time and his Lord spoke to him,
he said,
"My Lord,
show me [Yourself] that I may look at You.
" [God] said,
"You will not see Me,
but look at the mountain;
if it should remain in place,
then you will see Me.
" But when his Lord appeared to the mountain,
He rendered it level,
and Moses fell unconscious.
And when he awoke,
he said,
"Exalted are You!
I have repented to You,
and I am the first of the believers.

1098.verse-arabic: قَالَ يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنِّي اصْطَفَيْتُكَ عَلَى النَّاسِ بِرِسَالَاتِي وَبِكَلَامِي فَخُذْ مَا آتَيْتُكَ وَكُن مِّنَ الشَّاكِرِينَ
1098.verse-english: [Allah] said, "O Moses, I have chosen you over the people with My messages and My words [to you]. So take what I have given you and be among the grateful."

clauses-english.clause: [God] said,
"O Moses,
I have chosen you over the people with My messages and My words [to you].
So take what I have given you and be among the grateful.

1099.verse-arabic: وَكَتَبْنَا لَهُ فِي الْأَلْوَاحِ مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ مَّوْعِظَةً وَتَفْصِيلًا لِّكُلِّ شَيْءٍ فَخُذْهَا بِقُوَّةٍ وَأْمُرْ قَوْمَكَ يَأْخُذُوا بِأَحْسَنِهَا ۚ سَأُرِيكُمْ دَارَ الْفَاسِقِينَ
1099.verse-english: And We wrote for him on the tablets [something] of all things - instruction and explanation for all things, [saying], "Take them with determination and order your people to take the best of it. I will show you the home of the defiantly disobedient."

clauses-english.clause: And We wrote for him on the tablets [something] of all things -
instruction and explanation for all things,
[saying],
"Take them with determination and order your people to take the best of it.
I will show you the home of the defiantly disobedient.

1100.verse-arabic: سَأَصْرِفُ عَنْ آيَاتِيَ الَّذِينَ يَتَكَبَّرُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ الْحَقِّ وَإِن يَرَوْا كُلَّ آيَةٍ لَّا يُؤْمِنُوا بِهَا وَإِن يَرَوْا سَبِيلَ الرُّشْدِ لَا يَتَّخِذُوهُ سَبِيلًا وَإِن يَرَوْا سَبِيلَ الْغَيِّ يَتَّخِذُوهُ سَبِيلًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا وَكَانُوا عَنْهَا غَافِلِينَ
1100.verse-english: I will turn away from My signs those who are arrogant upon the earth without right; and if they should see every sign, they will not believe in it. And if they see the way of consciousness, they will not adopt it as a way; but if they see the way of error, they will adopt it as a way. That is because they have denied Our signs and they were heedless of them.

clauses-english.clause: I will turn away from My signs those who are arrogant upon the earth without right;
and if they should see every sign,
they will not believe in it.
And if they see the way of consciousness,
they will not adopt it as a way;
but if they see the way of error,
they will adopt it as a way.
That is because they have denied Our signs and they were heedless of them.

1101.verse-arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا وَلِقَاءِ الْآخِرَةِ حَبِطَتْ أَعْمَالُهُمْ ۚ هَلْ يُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
1101.verse-english: Those who denied Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter - their deeds have become worthless. Are they recompensed except for what they used to do?

clauses-english.clause: Those who denied Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter -
their deeds have become worthless.
Are they recompensed except for what they used to do?

1102.verse-arabic: وَاتَّخَذَ قَوْمُ مُوسَىٰ مِن بَعْدِهِ مِنْ حُلِيِّهِمْ عِجْلًا جَسَدًا لَّهُ خُوَارٌ ۚ أَلَمْ يَرَوْا أَنَّهُ لَا يُكَلِّمُهُمْ وَلَا يَهْدِيهِمْ سَبِيلًا ۘ اتَّخَذُوهُ وَكَانُوا ظَالِمِينَ
1102.verse-english: And the people of Moses made, after [his departure], from their ornaments a calf - an image having a lowing sound. Did they not see that it could neither speak to them nor guide them to a way? They took it [for worship], and they were wrongdoers.

clauses-english.clause: And the people of Moses made,
after [his departure],
from their ornaments a calf -
an image having a lowing sound.
