Did they not see that it could neither speak to them nor guide them to a way?
They took it [for worship],
and they were wrongdoers.

1103.verse-arabic: وَلَمَّا سُقِطَ فِي أَيْدِيهِمْ وَرَأَوْا أَنَّهُمْ قَدْ ضَلُّوا قَالُوا لَئِن لَّمْ يَرْحَمْنَا رَبُّنَا وَيَغْفِرْ لَنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ
1103.verse-english: And when regret overcame them and they saw that they had gone astray, they said, "If our Lord does not have mercy upon us and forgive us, we will surely be among the losers."

clauses-english.clause: And when regret overcame them and they saw that they had gone astray,
they said,
"If our Lord does not have mercy upon us and forgive us,
we will surely be among the losers.

1104.verse-arabic: وَلَمَّا رَجَعَ مُوسَىٰ إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ غَضْبَانَ أَسِفًا قَالَ بِئْسَمَا خَلَفْتُمُونِي مِن بَعْدِي ۖ أَعَجِلْتُمْ أَمْرَ رَبِّكُمْ ۖ وَأَلْقَى الْأَلْوَاحَ وَأَخَذَ بِرَأْسِ أَخِيهِ يَجُرُّهُ إِلَيْهِ ۚ قَالَ ابْنَ أُمَّ إِنَّ الْقَوْمَ اسْتَضْعَفُونِي وَكَادُوا يَقْتُلُونَنِي فَلَا تُشْمِتْ بِيَ الْأَعْدَاءَ وَلَا تَجْعَلْنِي مَعَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
1104.verse-english: And when Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved, he said, "How wretched is that by which you have replaced me after [my departure]. Were you impatient over the matter of your Lord?" And he threw down the tablets and seized his brother by [the hair of] his head, pulling him toward him. [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, indeed the people oppressed me and were about to kill me, so let not the enemies rejoice over me and do not place me among the wrongdoing people."

clauses-english.clause: And when Moses returned to his people,
angry and grieved,
he said,
"How wretched is that by which you have replaced me after [my departure].
Were you impatient over the matter of your Lord?
" And he threw down the tablets and seized his brother by [the hair of] his head,
pulling him toward him.
[Aaron] said,
"O son of my mother,
indeed the people oppressed me and were about to kill me,
so let not the enemies rejoice over me and do not place me among the wrongdoing people.

1105.verse-arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِأَخِي وَأَدْخِلْنَا فِي رَحْمَتِكَ ۖ وَأَنتَ أَرْحَمُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
1105.verse-english: [Moses] said, "My Lord, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy, for You are the most merciful of the merciful."

clauses-english.clause: [Moses] said,
"My Lord,
forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy,
for You are the most merciful of the merciful.

1106.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ اتَّخَذُوا الْعِجْلَ سَيَنَالُهُمْ غَضَبٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ وَذِلَّةٌ فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُفْتَرِينَ
1106.verse-english: Indeed, those who took the calf [for worship] will obtain anger from their Lord and humiliation in the life of this world, and thus do We recompense the inventors [of falsehood].

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
those who took the calf [for worship] will obtain anger from their Lord and humiliation in the life of this world,
and thus do We recompense the inventors [of falsehood].

1107.verse-arabic: وَالَّذِينَ عَمِلُوا السَّيِّئَاتِ ثُمَّ تَابُوا مِن بَعْدِهَا وَآمَنُوا إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِن بَعْدِهَا لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
1107.verse-english: But those who committed misdeeds and then repented after them and believed - indeed your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: But those who committed misdeeds and then repented after them and believed -
indeed your Lord,
thereafter,
is Forgiving and Merciful.

1108.verse-arabic: وَلَمَّا سَكَتَ عَن مُّوسَى الْغَضَبُ أَخَذَ الْأَلْوَاحَ ۖ وَفِي نُسْخَتِهَا هُدًى وَرَحْمَةٌ لِّلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِرَبِّهِمْ يَرْهَبُونَ
1108.verse-english: And when the anger subsided in Moses, he took up the tablets; and in their inscription was guidance and mercy for those who are fearful of their Lord.

clauses-english.clause: And when the anger subsided in Moses,
he took up the tablets;
and in their inscription was guidance and mercy for those who are fearful of their Lord.

1109.verse-arabic: وَاخْتَارَ مُوسَىٰ قَوْمَهُ سَبْعِينَ رَجُلًا لِّمِيقَاتِنَا ۖ فَلَمَّا أَخَذَتْهُمُ الرَّجْفَةُ قَالَ رَبِّ لَوْ شِئْتَ أَهْلَكْتَهُم مِّن قَبْلُ وَإِيَّايَ ۖ أَتُهْلِكُنَا بِمَا فَعَلَ السُّفَهَاءُ مِنَّا ۖ إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا فِتْنَتُكَ تُضِلُّ بِهَا مَن تَشَاءُ وَتَهْدِي مَن تَشَاءُ ۖ أَنتَ وَلِيُّنَا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَارْحَمْنَا ۖ وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الْغَافِرِينَ
1109.verse-english: And Moses chose from his people seventy men for Our appointment. And when the earthquake seized them, he said, "My Lord, if You had willed, You could have destroyed them before and me [as well]. Would You destroy us for what the foolish among us have done? This is not but Your trial by which You send astray whom You will and guide whom You will. You are our Protector, so forgive us and have mercy upon us; and You are the best of forgivers.

clauses-english.clause: And Moses chose from his people seventy men for Our appointment.
And when the earthquake seized them,
he said,
"My Lord,
if You had willed,
You could have destroyed them before and me [as well].
Would You destroy us for what the foolish among us have done?
This is not but Your trial by which You send astray whom You will and guide whom You will.
You are our Protector,
so forgive us and have mercy upon us;
and You are the best of forgivers.

1110.verse-arabic: ۞ وَاكْتُبْ لَنَا فِي هَٰذِهِ الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ إِنَّا هُدْنَا إِلَيْكَ ۚ قَالَ عَذَابِي أُصِيبُ بِهِ مَنْ أَشَاءُ ۖ وَرَحْمَتِي وَسِعَتْ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ ۚ فَسَأَكْتُبُهَا لِلَّذِينَ يَتَّقُونَ وَيُؤْتُونَ الزَّكَاةَ وَالَّذِينَ هُم بِآيَاتِنَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
1110.verse-english: And decree for us in this world [that which is] good and [also] in the Hereafter; indeed, we have turned back to You." [Allah] said, "My punishment - I afflict with it whom I will, but My mercy encompasses all things." So I will decree it [especially] for those who fear Me and give zakah and those who believe in Our verses -

clauses-english.clause: And decree for us in this world [that which is] good and [also] in the Hereafter;
indeed,
we have turned back to You.
" [God] said,
"My punishment -
I afflict with it whom I will,
but My mercy encompasses all things.
" So I will decree it [especially] for those who fear Me and give zakah and those who believe in Our verses -

1111.verse-arabic: الَّذِينَ يَتَّبِعُونَ الرَّسُولَ النَّبِيَّ الْأُمِّيَّ الَّذِي يَجِدُونَهُ مَكْتُوبًا عِندَهُمْ فِي التَّوْرَاةِ وَالْإِنجِيلِ يَأْمُرُهُم بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَنْهَاهُمْ عَنِ الْمُنكَرِ وَيُحِلُّ لَهُمُ الطَّيِّبَاتِ وَيُحَرِّمُ عَلَيْهِمُ الْخَبَائِثَ وَيَضَعُ عَنْهُمْ إِصْرَهُمْ وَالْأَغْلَالَ الَّتِي كَانَتْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ فَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِهِ وَعَزَّرُوهُ وَنَصَرُوهُ وَاتَّبَعُوا النُّورَ الَّذِي أُنزِلَ مَعَهُ ۙ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
1111.verse-english: Those who follow the Messenger, the unlettered prophet, whom they find written in what they have of the Torah and the Gospel, who enjoins upon them what is right and forbids them what is wrong and makes lawful for them the good things and prohibits for them the evil and relieves them of their burden and the shackles which were upon them. So they who have believed in him, honored him, supported him and followed the light which was sent down with him - it is those who will be the successful.

clauses-english.clause: Those who follow the Messenger,
the unlettered prophet,
whom they find written in what they have of the Torah and the Gospel,

who enjoins upon them what is right and forbids them what is wrong and makes lawful for them the good things and prohibits for them the evil and relieves them of their burden and the shackles which were upon them.
So they who have believed in him,
honored him,
supported him and followed the light which was sent down with him -
it is those who will be the successful.

1112.verse-arabic: قُلْ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ إِنِّي رَسُولُ اللَّهِ إِلَيْكُمْ جَمِيعًا الَّذِي لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ ۖ فَآمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ النَّبِيِّ الْأُمِّيِّ الَّذِي يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَكَلِمَاتِهِ وَاتَّبِعُوهُ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
1112.verse-english: Say, [O Muhammad], "O mankind, indeed I am the Messenger of Allah to you all, [from Him] to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death." So believe in Allah and His Messenger, the unlettered prophet, who believes in Allah and His words, and follow him that you may be guided.

clauses-english.clause: Say,
[O Muhammad],
"O mankind,
indeed I am the Messenger of God to you all,
[from Him] to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth.
There is no deity except Him;
He gives life and causes death.
" So believe in God and His Messenger,
the unlettered prophet,
who believes in God and His words,
and follow him that you may be guided.

1113.verse-arabic: وَمِن قَوْمِ مُوسَىٰ أُمَّةٌ يَهْدُونَ بِالْحَقِّ وَبِهِ يَعْدِلُونَ
1113.verse-english: And among the people of Moses is a community which guides by truth and by it establishes justice.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَمِن قَوْمِ مُوسَىٰ أُمَّةٌ يَهْدُونَ بِالْحَقِّ وَبِهِ يَعْدِلُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And among the people of Moses is a community which guides by truth and by it establishes justice.

1114.verse-arabic: وَقَطَّعْنَاهُمُ اثْنَتَيْ عَشْرَةَ أَسْبَاطًا أُمَمًا ۚ وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ إِذِ اسْتَسْقَاهُ قَوْمُهُ أَنِ اضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ الْحَجَرَ ۖ فَانبَجَسَتْ مِنْهُ اثْنَتَا عَشْرَةَ عَيْنًا ۖ قَدْ عَلِمَ كُلُّ أُنَاسٍ مَّشْرَبَهُمْ ۚ وَظَلَّلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الْغَمَامَ وَأَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الْمَنَّ وَالسَّلْوَىٰ ۖ كُلُوا مِن طَيِّبَاتِ مَا رَزَقْنَاكُمْ ۚ وَمَا ظَلَمُونَا وَلَٰكِن كَانُوا أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
1114.verse-english: And We divided them into twelve descendant tribes [as distinct] nations. And We inspired to Moses when his people implored him for water, "Strike with your staff the stone," and there gushed forth from it twelve springs. Every people knew its watering place. And We shaded them with clouds and sent down upon them manna and quails, [saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you." And they wronged Us not, but they were [only] wronging themselves.

clauses-english.clause: And We divided them into twelve descendant tribes [as distinct] nations.
And We inspired to Moses when his people implored him for water,
"Strike with your staff the stone,
" and there gushed forth from it twelve springs.
Every people knew its watering place.
And We shaded them with clouds and sent down upon them manna and quails,
[saying],
"Eat from the good things with which We have provided you.
" And they wronged Us not,
but they were [only] wronging themselves.

1115.verse-arabic: وَإِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمُ اسْكُنُوا هَٰذِهِ الْقَرْيَةَ وَكُلُوا مِنْهَا حَيْثُ شِئْتُمْ وَقُولُوا حِطَّةٌ وَادْخُلُوا الْبَابَ سُجَّدًا نَّغْفِرْ لَكُمْ خَطِيئَاتِكُمْ ۚ سَنَزِيدُ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
1115.verse-english: And [mention, O Muhammad], when it was said to them, "Dwell in this city and eat from it wherever you will and say, 'Relieve us of our burdens,' and enter the gate bowing humbly; We will [then] forgive you your sins. We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward]."

clauses-english.clause: And [mention,
O Muhammad],
when it was said to them,
"Dwell in this city and eat from it wherever you will and say,
'Relieve us of our burdens,
' and enter the gate bowing humbly;
We will [then] forgive you your sins.
We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward].

1116.verse-arabic: فَبَدَّلَ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا مِنْهُمْ قَوْلًا غَيْرَ الَّذِي قِيلَ لَهُمْ فَأَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِجْزًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ بِمَا كَانُوا يَظْلِمُونَ
1116.verse-english: But those who wronged among them changed [the words] to a statement other than that which had been said to them. So We sent upon them a punishment from the sky for the wrong that they were doing.

clauses-english.clause: But those who wronged among them changed [the words] to a statement other than that which had been said to them.
So We sent upon them a punishment from the sky for the wrong that they were doing.

1117.verse-arabic: وَاسْأَلْهُمْ عَنِ الْقَرْيَةِ الَّتِي كَانَتْ حَاضِرَةَ الْبَحْرِ إِذْ يَعْدُونَ فِي السَّبْتِ إِذْ تَأْتِيهِمْ حِيتَانُهُمْ يَوْمَ سَبْتِهِمْ شُرَّعًا وَيَوْمَ لَا يَسْبِتُونَ ۙ لَا تَأْتِيهِمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَبْلُوهُم بِمَا كَانُوا يَفْسُقُونَ
1117.verse-english: And ask them about the town that was by the sea - when they transgressed in [the matter of] the sabbath - when their fish came to them openly on their sabbath day, and the day they had no sabbath they did not come to them. Thus did We give them trial because they were defiantly disobedient.

clauses-english.clause: And ask them about the town that was by the sea -
when they transgressed in [the matter of] the sabbath -
when their fish came to them openly on their sabbath day,
and the day they had no sabbath they did not come to them.
Thus did We give them trial because they were defiantly disobedient.

1118.verse-arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَتْ أُمَّةٌ مِّنْهُمْ لِمَ تَعِظُونَ قَوْمًا ۙ اللَّهُ مُهْلِكُهُمْ أَوْ مُعَذِّبُهُمْ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا ۖ قَالُوا مَعْذِرَةً إِلَىٰ رَبِّكُمْ وَلَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ
1118.verse-english: And when a community among them said, "Why do you advise [or warn] a people whom Allah is [about] to destroy or to punish with a severe punishment?" they [the advisors] said, "To be absolved before your Lord and perhaps they may fear Him."

clauses-english.clause: And when a community among them said,
"Why do you advise [or warn] a people whom God is [about] to destroy or to punish with a severe punishment?
" they [the advisors] said,
"To be absolved before your Lord and perhaps they may fear Him.

1119.verse-arabic: فَلَمَّا نَسُوا مَا ذُكِّرُوا بِهِ أَنجَيْنَا الَّذِينَ يَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ السُّوءِ وَأَخَذْنَا الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا بِعَذَابٍ بَئِيسٍ بِمَا كَانُوا يَفْسُقُونَ
1119.verse-english: And when they forgot that by which they had been reminded, We saved those who had forbidden evil and seized those who wronged, with a wretched punishment, because they were defiantly disobeying.

clauses-english.clause: And when they forgot that by which they had been reminded,
We saved those who had forbidden evil and seized those who wronged,
with a wretched punishment,
because they were defiantly disobeying.

1120.verse-arabic: فَلَمَّا عَتَوْا عَن مَّا نُهُوا عَنْهُ قُلْنَا لَهُمْ كُونُوا قِرَدَةً خَاسِئِينَ
1120.verse-english: So when they were insolent about that which they had been forbidden, We said to them, "Be apes, despised."

clauses-english.clause: So when they were insolent about that which they had been forbidden,
We said to them,
"Be apes,
despised.

1121.verse-arabic: وَإِذْ تَأَذَّنَ رَبُّكَ لَيَبْعَثَنَّ عَلَيْهِمْ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ مَن يَسُومُهُمْ سُوءَ الْعَذَابِ ۗ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَسَرِيعُ الْعِقَابِ ۖ وَإِنَّهُ لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
1121.verse-english: And [mention] when your Lord declared that He would surely [continue to] send upon them until the Day of Resurrection those who would afflict them with the worst torment. Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: And [mention] when your Lord declared that He would surely [continue to] send upon them until the Day of Resurrection those who would afflict them with the worst torment.
Indeed,
your Lord is swift in penalty;
but indeed,
He is Forgiving and Merciful.

1122.verse-arabic: وَقَطَّعْنَاهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ أُمَمًا ۖ مِّنْهُمُ الصَّالِحُونَ وَمِنْهُمْ دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَبَلَوْنَاهُم بِالْحَسَنَاتِ وَالسَّيِّئَاتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
1122.verse-english: And We divided them throughout the earth into nations. Of them some were righteous, and of them some were otherwise. And We tested them with good [times] and bad that perhaps they would return [to obedience].

clauses-english.clause: And We divided them throughout the earth into nations.
Of them some were righteous,
and of them some were otherwise.
And We tested them with good [times] and bad that perhaps they would return [to obedience].

1123.verse-arabic: فَخَلَفَ مِن بَعْدِهِمْ خَلْفٌ وَرِثُوا الْكِتَابَ يَأْخُذُونَ عَرَضَ هَٰذَا الْأَدْنَىٰ وَيَقُولُونَ سَيُغْفَرُ لَنَا وَإِن يَأْتِهِمْ عَرَضٌ مِّثْلُهُ يَأْخُذُوهُ ۚ أَلَمْ يُؤْخَذْ عَلَيْهِم مِّيثَاقُ الْكِتَابِ أَن لَّا يَقُولُوا عَلَى اللَّهِ إِلَّا الْحَقَّ وَدَرَسُوا مَا فِيهِ ۗ وَالدَّارُ الْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لِّلَّذِينَ يَتَّقُونَ ۗ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
1123.verse-english: And there followed them successors who inherited the Scripture [while] taking the commodities of this lower life and saying, "It will be forgiven for us." And if an offer like it comes to them, they will [again] take it. Was not the covenant of the Scripture taken from them that they would not say about Allah except the truth, and they studied what was in it? And the home of the Hereafter is better for those who fear Allah, so will you not use reason?

clauses-english.clause: And there followed them successors who inherited the Scripture [while] taking the commodities of this lower life and saying,
"It will be forgiven for us.
" And if an offer like it comes to them,
they will [again] take it.
Was not the covenant of the Scripture taken from them that they would not say about God except the truth,
and they studied what was in it?
And the home of the Hereafter is better for those who fear God,
so will you not use reason?

1124.verse-arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يُمَسِّكُونَ بِالْكِتَابِ وَأَقَامُوا الصَّلَاةَ إِنَّا لَا نُضِيعُ أَجْرَ الْمُصْلِحِينَ
1124.verse-english: But those who hold fast to the Book and establish prayer - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of the reformers.

clauses-english.clause: But those who hold fast to the Book and establish prayer -
indeed,
We will not allow to be lost the reward of the reformers.

1125.verse-arabic: ۞ وَإِذْ نَتَقْنَا الْجَبَلَ فَوْقَهُمْ كَأَنَّهُ ظُلَّةٌ وَظَنُّوا أَنَّهُ وَاقِعٌ بِهِمْ خُذُوا مَا آتَيْنَاكُم بِقُوَّةٍ وَاذْكُرُوا مَا فِيهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُونَ
1125.verse-english: And [mention] when We raised the mountain above them as if it was a dark cloud and they were certain that it would fall upon them, [and Allah said], "Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it that you might fear Allah."

clauses-english.clause: And [mention] when We raised the mountain above them as if it was a dark cloud and they were certain that it would fall upon them,
[and God said],
"Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it that you might fear God.

1126.verse-arabic: وَإِذْ أَخَذَ رَبُّكَ مِن بَنِي آدَمَ مِن ظُهُورِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَأَشْهَدَهُمْ عَلَىٰ أَنفُسِهِمْ أَلَسْتُ بِرَبِّكُمْ ۖ قَالُوا بَلَىٰ ۛ شَهِدْنَا ۛ أَن تَقُولُوا يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ إِنَّا كُنَّا عَنْ هَٰذَا غَافِلِينَ
1126.verse-english: And [mention] when your Lord took from the children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants and made them testify of themselves, [saying to them], "Am I not your Lord?" They said, "Yes, we have testified." [This] - lest you should say on the day of Resurrection, "Indeed, we were of this unaware."

clauses-english.clause: And [mention] when your Lord took from the children of Adam -
from their loins -
their descendants and made them testify of themselves,
[saying to them],
"Am I not your Lord?
" They said,
"Yes,
we have testified.
" [This] -
lest you should say on the day of Resurrection,
"Indeed,
we were of this unaware.

1127.verse-arabic: أَوْ تَقُولُوا إِنَّمَا أَشْرَكَ آبَاؤُنَا مِن قَبْلُ وَكُنَّا ذُرِّيَّةً مِّن بَعْدِهِمْ ۖ أَفَتُهْلِكُنَا بِمَا فَعَلَ الْمُبْطِلُونَ
1127.verse-english: Or [lest] you say, "It was only that our fathers associated [others in worship] with Allah before, and we were but descendants after them. Then would You destroy us for what the falsifiers have done?"

clauses-english.clause: Or [lest] you say,
"It was only that our fathers associated [others in worship] with God before,
and we were but descendants after them.
Then would You destroy us for what the falsifiers have done?

1128.verse-english: And thus do We [explain in] detail the verses, and perhaps they will return.

clauses-english.clause: And thus do We [explain in] detail the verses,
and perhaps they will return.

1129.verse-arabic: وَاتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ الَّذِي آتَيْنَاهُ آيَاتِنَا فَانسَلَخَ مِنْهَا فَأَتْبَعَهُ الشَّيْطَانُ فَكَانَ مِنَ الْغَاوِينَ
1129.verse-english: And recite to them, [O Muhammad], the news of him to whom we gave [knowledge of] Our signs, but he detached himself from them; so Satan pursued him, and he became of the deviators.

clauses-english.clause: And recite to them,
[O Muhammad],
the news of him to whom we gave [knowledge of] Our signs,
but he detached himself from them;
so Satan pursued him,
and he became of the deviators.

1130.verse-arabic: وَلَوْ شِئْنَا لَرَفَعْنَاهُ بِهَا وَلَٰكِنَّهُ أَخْلَدَ إِلَى الْأَرْضِ وَاتَّبَعَ هَوَاهُ ۚ فَمَثَلُهُ كَمَثَلِ الْكَلْبِ إِن تَحْمِلْ عَلَيْهِ يَلْهَثْ أَوْ تَتْرُكْهُ يَلْهَث ۚ ذَّٰلِكَ مَثَلُ الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا ۚ فَاقْصُصِ الْقَصَصَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
1130.verse-english: And if We had willed, we could have elevated him thereby, but he adhered [instead] to the earth and followed his own desire. So his example is like that of the dog: if you chase him, he pants, or if you leave him, he [still] pants. That is the example of the people who denied Our signs. So relate the stories that perhaps they will give thought.

clauses-english.clause: And if We had willed,
we could have elevated him thereby,
but he adhered [instead] to the earth and followed his own desire.
So his example is like that of the dog:
if you chase him,
he pants,
or if you leave him,
he [still] pants.
That is the example of the people who denied Our signs.
So relate the stories that perhaps they will give thought.

1131.verse-arabic: سَاءَ مَثَلًا الْقَوْمُ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا وَأَنفُسَهُمْ كَانُوا يَظْلِمُونَ
1131.verse-english: How evil an example [is that of] the people who denied Our signs and used to wrong themselves.

clauses-arabic.clause: سَاءَ مَثَلًا الْقَوْمُ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا وَأَنفُسَهُمْ كَانُوا يَظْلِمُونَ

clauses-english.clause: How evil an example [is that of] the people who denied Our signs and used to wrong themselves.

1132.verse-arabic: مَن يَهْدِ اللَّهُ فَهُوَ الْمُهْتَدِي ۖ وَمَن يُضْلِلْ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْخَاسِرُونَ
1132.verse-english: Whoever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - it is those who are the losers.

clauses-english.clause: Whoever God guides -
he is the [rightly] guided;
and whoever He sends astray -
it is those who are the losers.

1133.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ ذَرَأْنَا لِجَهَنَّمَ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنسِ ۖ لَهُمْ قُلُوبٌ لَّا يَفْقَهُونَ بِهَا وَلَهُمْ أَعْيُنٌ لَّا يُبْصِرُونَ بِهَا وَلَهُمْ آذَانٌ لَّا يَسْمَعُونَ بِهَا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ كَالْأَنْعَامِ بَلْ هُمْ أَضَلُّ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْغَافِلُونَ
1133.verse-english: And We have certainly created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind. They have hearts with which they do not understand, they have eyes with which they do not see, and they have ears with which they do not hear. Those are like livestock; rather, they are more astray. It is they who are the heedless.

clauses-english.clause: And We have certainly created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind.
They have hearts with which they do not understand,
they have eyes with which they do not see,
and they have ears with which they do not hear.
Those are like livestock;
rather,
they are more astray.
It is they who are the heedless.

1134.verse-arabic: وَلِلَّهِ الْأَسْمَاءُ الْحُسْنَىٰ فَادْعُوهُ بِهَا ۖ وَذَرُوا الَّذِينَ يُلْحِدُونَ فِي أَسْمَائِهِ ۚ سَيُجْزَوْنَ مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
1134.verse-english: And to Allah belong the best names, so invoke Him by them. And leave [the company of] those who practice deviation concerning His names. They will be recompensed for what they have been doing.

clauses-english.clause: And to God belong the best names,
so invoke Him by them.
And leave [the company of] those who practice deviation concerning His names.
They will be recompensed for what they have been doing.

1135.verse-arabic: وَمِمَّنْ خَلَقْنَا أُمَّةٌ يَهْدُونَ بِالْحَقِّ وَبِهِ يَعْدِلُونَ
1135.verse-english: And among those We created is a community which guides by truth and thereby establishes justice.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَمِمَّنْ خَلَقْنَا أُمَّةٌ يَهْدُونَ بِالْحَقِّ وَبِهِ يَعْدِلُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And among those We created is a community which guides by truth and thereby establishes justice.

1136.verse-arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
1136.verse-english: But those who deny Our signs - We will progressively lead them [to destruction] from where they do not know.

clauses-english.clause: But those who deny Our signs -
We will progressively lead them [to destruction] from where they do not know.

1137.verse-english: And I will give them time. Indeed, my plan is firm.

clauses-english.clause: And I will give them time.
Indeed,
my plan is firm.

1138.verse-arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَتَفَكَّرُوا ۗ مَا بِصَاحِبِهِم مِّن جِنَّةٍ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
1138.verse-english: Then do they not give thought? There is in their companion [Muhammad] no madness. He is not but a clear warner.

clauses-english.clause: Then do they not give thought?
There is in their companion [Muhammad] no madness.
He is not but a clear warner.

1139.verse-arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَنظُرُوا فِي مَلَكُوتِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا خَلَقَ اللَّهُ مِن شَيْءٍ وَأَنْ عَسَىٰ أَن يَكُونَ قَدِ اقْتَرَبَ أَجَلُهُمْ ۖ فَبِأَيِّ حَدِيثٍ بَعْدَهُ يُؤْمِنُونَ
1139.verse-english: Do they not look into the realm of the heavens and the earth and everything that Allah has created and [think] that perhaps their appointed time has come near? So in what statement hereafter will they believe?

clauses-english.clause: Do they not look into the realm of the heavens and the earth and everything that God has created and [think] that perhaps their appointed time has come near?
So in what statement hereafter will they believe?

1140.verse-arabic: مَن يُضْلِلِ اللَّهُ فَلَا هَادِيَ لَهُ ۚ وَيَذَرُهُمْ فِي طُغْيَانِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
1140.verse-english: Whoever Allah sends astray - there is no guide for him. And He leaves them in their transgression, wandering blindly.

clauses-english.clause: Whoever God sends astray -
there is no guide for him.
And He leaves them in their transgression,
wandering blindly.

1141.verse-arabic: يَسْأَلُونَكَ عَنِ السَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرْسَاهَا ۖ قُلْ إِنَّمَا عِلْمُهَا عِندَ رَبِّي ۖ لَا يُجَلِّيهَا لِوَقْتِهَا إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ ثَقُلَتْ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ لَا تَأْتِيكُمْ إِلَّا بَغْتَةً ۗ يَسْأَلُونَكَ كَأَنَّكَ حَفِيٌّ عَنْهَا ۖ قُلْ إِنَّمَا عِلْمُهَا عِندَ اللَّهِ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
1141.verse-english: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival? Say, "Its knowledge is only with my Lord. None will reveal its time except Him. It lays heavily upon the heavens and the earth. It will not come upon you except unexpectedly." They ask you as if you are familiar with it. Say, "Its knowledge is only with Allah, but most of the people do not know."

clauses-english.clause: They ask you,
[O Muhammad],
about the Hour:
when is its arrival?
Say,
"Its knowledge is only with my Lord.
None will reveal its time except Him.
It lays heavily upon the heavens and the earth.
It will not come upon you except unexpectedly.
" They ask you as if you are familiar with it.
Say,
"Its knowledge is only with God,
but most of the people do not know.

1142.verse-arabic: قُل لَّا أَمْلِكُ لِنَفْسِي نَفْعًا وَلَا ضَرًّا إِلَّا مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ وَلَوْ كُنتُ أَعْلَمُ الْغَيْبَ لَاسْتَكْثَرْتُ مِنَ الْخَيْرِ وَمَا مَسَّنِيَ السُّوءُ ۚ إِنْ أَنَا إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ وَبَشِيرٌ لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
1142.verse-english: Say, "I hold not for myself [the power of] benefit or harm, except what Allah has willed. And if I knew the unseen, I could have acquired much wealth, and no harm would have touched me. I am not except a warner and a bringer of good tidings to a people who believe."

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"I hold not for myself [the power of] benefit or harm,
except what God has willed.
And if I knew the unseen,
I could have acquired much wealth,
and no harm would have touched me.
I am not except a warner and a bringer of good tidings to a people who believe.

1143.verse-arabic: ۞ هُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَكُم مِّن نَّفْسٍ وَاحِدَةٍ وَجَعَلَ مِنْهَا زَوْجَهَا لِيَسْكُنَ إِلَيْهَا ۖ فَلَمَّا تَغَشَّاهَا حَمَلَتْ حَمْلًا خَفِيفًا فَمَرَّتْ بِهِ ۖ فَلَمَّا أَثْقَلَت دَّعَوَا اللَّهَ رَبَّهُمَا لَئِنْ آتَيْتَنَا صَالِحًا لَّنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الشَّاكِرِينَ
1143.verse-english: It is He who created you from one soul and created from it its mate that he might dwell in security with her. And when he covers her, she carries a light burden and continues therein. And when it becomes heavy, they both invoke Allah, their Lord, "If You should give us a good [child], we will surely be among the grateful."

clauses-english.clause: It is He who created you from one soul and created from it its mate that he might dwell in security with her.
And when he covers her,
she carries a light burden and continues therein.
And when it becomes heavy,
they both invoke God,
their Lord,
"If You should give us a good [child],
we will surely be among the grateful.

1144.verse-arabic: فَلَمَّا آتَاهُمَا صَالِحًا جَعَلَا لَهُ شُرَكَاءَ فِيمَا آتَاهُمَا ۚ فَتَعَالَى اللَّهُ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
1144.verse-english: But when He gives them a good [child], they ascribe partners to Him concerning that which He has given them. Exalted is Allah above what they associate with Him.

clauses-english.clause: But when He gives them a good [child],
they ascribe partners to Him concerning that which He has given them.
Exalted is God above what they associate with Him.

1145.verse-arabic: أَيُشْرِكُونَ مَا لَا يَخْلُقُ شَيْئًا وَهُمْ يُخْلَقُونَ
1145.verse-english: Do they associate with Him those who create nothing and they are [themselves] created?

clauses-arabic.clause: أَيُشْرِكُونَ مَا لَا يَخْلُقُ شَيْئًا وَهُمْ يُخْلَقُونَ

clauses-english.clause: Do they associate with Him those who create nothing and they are [themselves] created?

1146.verse-arabic: وَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ لَهُمْ نَصْرًا وَلَا أَنفُسَهُمْ يَنصُرُونَ
1146.verse-english: And the false deities are unable to [give] them help, nor can they help themselves.

clauses-english.clause: And the false deities are unable to [give] them help,
nor can they help themselves.

1147.verse-arabic: وَإِن تَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَى الْهُدَىٰ لَا يَتَّبِعُوكُمْ ۚ سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْكُمْ أَدَعَوْتُمُوهُمْ أَمْ أَنتُمْ صَامِتُونَ
1147.verse-english: And if you [believers] invite them to guidance, they will not follow you. It is all the same for you whether you invite them or you are silent.

clauses-english.clause: And if you [believers] invite them to guidance,
they will not follow you.
It is all the same for you whether you invite them or you are silent.

1148.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ عِبَادٌ أَمْثَالُكُمْ ۖ فَادْعُوهُمْ فَلْيَسْتَجِيبُوا لَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
1148.verse-english: Indeed, those you [polytheists] call upon besides Allah are servants like you. So call upon them and let them respond to you, if you should be truthful.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
those you [polytheists] call upon besides God are servants like you.
So call upon them and let them respond to you,
if you should be truthful.

1149.verse-arabic: أَلَهُمْ أَرْجُلٌ يَمْشُونَ بِهَا ۖ أَمْ لَهُمْ أَيْدٍ يَبْطِشُونَ بِهَا ۖ أَمْ لَهُمْ أَعْيُنٌ يُبْصِرُونَ بِهَا ۖ أَمْ لَهُمْ آذَانٌ يَسْمَعُونَ بِهَا ۗ قُلِ ادْعُوا شُرَكَاءَكُمْ ثُمَّ كِيدُونِ فَلَا تُنظِرُونِ
1149.verse-english: Do they have feet by which they walk? Or do they have hands by which they strike? Or do they have eyes by which they see? Or do they have ears by which they hear? Say, [O Muhammad], "Call your 'partners' and then conspire against me and give me no respite.

clauses-english.clause: Do they have feet by which they walk?
Or do they have hands by which they strike?
Or do they have eyes by which they see?
Or do they have ears by which they hear?
Say,
[O Muhammad],
"Call your 'partners' and then conspire against me and give me no respite.

1150.verse-arabic: إِنَّ وَلِيِّيَ اللَّهُ الَّذِي نَزَّلَ الْكِتَابَ ۖ وَهُوَ يَتَوَلَّى الصَّالِحِينَ
1150.verse-english: Indeed, my protector is Allah, who has sent down the Book; and He is an ally to the righteous.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
my protector is God,
who has sent down the Book;
and He is an ally to the righteous.

1151.verse-arabic: وَالَّذِينَ تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَكُمْ وَلَا أَنفُسَهُمْ يَنصُرُونَ
1151.verse-english: And those you call upon besides Him are unable to help you, nor can they help themselves."

clauses-english.clause: And those you call upon besides Him are unable to help you,
nor can they help themselves.

1152.verse-arabic: وَإِن تَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَى الْهُدَىٰ لَا يَسْمَعُوا ۖ وَتَرَاهُمْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَيْكَ وَهُمْ لَا يُبْصِرُونَ
1152.verse-english: And if you invite them to guidance, they do not hear; and you see them looking at you while they do not see.

clauses-english.clause: And if you invite them to guidance,
they do not hear;
and you see them looking at you while they do not see.

1153.verse-arabic: خُذِ الْعَفْوَ وَأْمُرْ بِالْعُرْفِ وَأَعْرِضْ عَنِ الْجَاهِلِينَ
1153.verse-english: Take what is given freely, enjoin what is good, and turn away from the ignorant.

clauses-english.clause: Take what is given freely,
enjoin what is good,
and turn away from the ignorant.

1154.verse-arabic: وَإِمَّا يَنزَغَنَّكَ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ نَزْغٌ فَاسْتَعِذْ بِاللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
1154.verse-english: And if an evil suggestion comes to you from Satan, then seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, He is Hearing and Knowing.

clauses-english.clause: And if an evil suggestion comes to you from Satan,
then seek refuge in God.
Indeed,
He is Hearing and Knowing.

1155.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ اتَّقَوْا إِذَا مَسَّهُمْ طَائِفٌ مِّنَ الشَّيْطَانِ تَذَكَّرُوا فَإِذَا هُم مُّبْصِرُونَ
1155.verse-english: Indeed, those who fear Allah - when an impulse touches them from Satan, they remember [Him] and at once they have insight.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
those who fear God -
when an impulse touches them from Satan,
they remember [Him] and at once they have insight.

1156.verse-arabic: وَإِخْوَانُهُمْ يَمُدُّونَهُمْ فِي الْغَيِّ ثُمَّ لَا يُقْصِرُونَ
1156.verse-english: But their brothers - the devils increase them in error; then they do not stop short.

clauses-english.clause: But their brothers -
the devils increase them in error;
then they do not stop short.

1157.verse-arabic: وَإِذَا لَمْ تَأْتِهِم بِآيَةٍ قَالُوا لَوْلَا اجْتَبَيْتَهَا ۚ قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَتَّبِعُ مَا يُوحَىٰ إِلَيَّ مِن رَّبِّي ۚ هَٰذَا بَصَائِرُ مِن رَّبِّكُمْ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةٌ لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
1157.verse-english: And when you, [O Muhammad], do not bring them a sign, they say, "Why have you not contrived it?" Say, "I only follow what is revealed to me from my Lord. This [Qur'an] is enlightenment from your Lord and guidance and mercy for a people who believe."

clauses-english.clause: And when you,
[O Muhammad],
do not bring them a sign,
they say,
"Why have you not contrived it?
" Say,
"I only follow what is revealed to me from my Lord.
This [Qur'an] is enlightenment from your Lord and guidance and mercy for a people who believe.

1158.verse-arabic: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ الْقُرْآنُ فَاسْتَمِعُوا لَهُ وَأَنصِتُوا لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
1158.verse-english: So when the Qur'an is recited, then listen to it and pay attention that you may receive mercy.

clauses-english.clause: So when the Qur'an is recited,
then listen to it and pay attention that you may receive mercy.

1159.verse-arabic: وَاذْكُر رَّبَّكَ فِي نَفْسِكَ تَضَرُّعًا وَخِيفَةً وَدُونَ الْجَهْرِ مِنَ الْقَوْلِ بِالْغُدُوِّ وَالْآصَالِ وَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ الْغَافِلِينَ
1159.verse-english: And remember your Lord within yourself in humility and in fear without being apparent in speech - in the mornings and the evenings. And do not be among the heedless.

clauses-english.clause: And remember your Lord within yourself in humility and in fear without being apparent in speech -
in the mornings and the evenings.
And do not be among the heedless.

1160.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ عِندَ رَبِّكَ لَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ عَنْ عِبَادَتِهِ وَيُسَبِّحُونَهُ وَلَهُ يَسْجُدُونَ ۩
1160.verse-english: Indeed, those who are near your Lord are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, and they exalt Him, and to Him they prostrate.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
those who are near your Lord are not prevented by arrogance from His worship,
and they exalt Him,
and to Him they prostrate.
